You sighed in relief, looking back at your stub of a TAIL as it brushed against the COUNTER's side. You could not remember the last time it wagged so ferociously. Likely during a MISSION with the CREW, or when you were HIGH OFF YOUR ASS. SQUOAT was right about something, regardless of how cryptic he was.
Enough about this. You need to eat. You look like you've been stuck in space or something.
No kidding.
It's on the house. Your presence in llamanian propaganda really gave us Plant-Lovers more power over the Meaties on the station.

Did you really influence factionalism on this STATION? It didn't matter. You ordered a LARGE SALAD with lots of various FOREIGN BERRIES and VEGETABLES. You also grabbed the MOST EXPENSIVE WINE you could get to VUROBURO's dismay. It felt relieving to have PEOPLE who cared about your WELLBEING, even if it only benefited their partisan agendas. Taking a SEAT at the DINER, you idly watched the HOLOVISION, speaking to various others in indescribable MERRIMENT and JOY. In fact, it was too JOYOUS, reminding you of the CREW once again. You looked out the WINDOW and wondered where they were, and where you should go next.
Look man, I'm glad you guys are enjoying my presence here, but I think I need to get going.
After a COUPLE OF HOURS of DRINKING and MERRIMENT, you realized that you should probably pick up WES and find out more about the OTHER SQUOATLING.
Wait, just a word of advice.
Just before you left the DOOR, you looked back at VUROBURO to listen in.
Yeah?
You really need to get a change in clothes. The llamanian getup isn't exactly going to give you cover during the ongoing war.

You look down at yourself and realize you've been in your LLAMANIAN GARBS, a tight, yet comfortable, gray skinsuit with the Llamanian Republic insignia on it. As you dwell upon your ATTIRE, you realize how revealing the SUIT really was. Embarrassed, you cover your GROIN in SHAME. It was unbelievable that you've worn this for so long without realizing your PREDICAMENT. Maybe that was why many LLAMANIAN WOMEN were so attracted to you.
Thanks.
Best of luck anyhow. I'll back whatever you do.
You exit the DINER and leave the FEASTING DISTRICT, walking in on two TALL ALIENS threatening what appeared to be WES.
Wes, let us see the goods or we're going to have to do this the hard way.
I told you! I just escaped a Llamanian cellship! I have no money!
He does have something else we can extort out of him. I'm sure pictures could sell for a fortune.

Before you could do anything, IRENE immediately woke up. Your vision was suddenly enhanced with CROSSHAIRS over both the CRIMINALS' FACES and WEAK SPOTS, and you could feel the PACK starting to vibrate continuously. Rather than confront IRENE about this, you decided to puff out your CHEST and BE THE BIGGER MAN.
Hey, you two blokes. Get the hell off my friend.
They craned their HEADS over to your position and snickered.
Wes ain't got nothing on this fella over here.
Market could use some horns about now, eh Jlush?

They dropped WES and slowly edged towards you. The CROSSHAIRS were transitioning from GREEN to RED as they neared you, and the VISION in your LEFT EYE was following suit. You might have fucked up here, trying to save WES. How do you manage to get out this one?
Try to control the legs that came out earlier. ⇒
You back up from the two CRIMINALS, your hoof reaching for your MAGGO-PISTOL. However, you seem to come up EMPTY, having stashed your WEAPON in your SATCHEL. Damn it.
Let's not get any ideas, fellas. I killed a Llamanian general. I won't hesitate to gut you.
Why don't you do it then?
Yeah, why you backin' off, chicken?

You remember IRENE'S ARMS from earlier and attempt to muster out a COMMAND to grab WES and run back to the SHIP. Before you managed a word out, IRENE instantly pulled out two PLASMA CANNONS from the PACK, each shaped like a CRUSTACEAN'S APPENDAGE. The SPEAKER blared from within your HEAD, causing you to instinctively cover your EARS.
Scum like you were what I was programmed for.
What-
The CANNONS charged and immediately aimed at their HEADS, hollowing MASSIVE HOLES from the PLASMA SHOTS. The recoil from the blast caused you to fall back, exasperated from what just happened.
WHAT-WHAT THE FUCK?!

IRENE extended its ARMS and slowly propped you back up. It felt hard to breathe. The combination of the force emitted from the CANNONS along with the sudden and COLD MURDER of the CRIMINALS truly left you breathless. WES ran up to you and shook you to no avail. It seems you were knocked out.
Emmett, wake up already. We need to leave.
Alright, damn...
You're awake!
You open your eyes to see the CEILING of a BRIG CELL. It appears that WES brought you back to the SHIP.
Everyone was watching whenever you killed those two guys, so I was afraid they would try to grab you.
I didn't kill anyone.
You drove a hole into their skulls.
Irene did it. Without approval.
As I said, I will come to the rescue and impart my judgment without your consent if your heart rate gets high enough.
We should have left them alone. Killing them just makes me look bad and feel bad.
Maybe a thank you is in order. I cleaned the galaxy up a tiny bit and saved you.

You groan and get up, feeling GUILTY for letting the situation get that bad. At least WES was safe. Now that you're back at the SHIP, you manage that you could go to an OUTFITTER'S, on the STATION or not. Though, you don't have much MONEY. LLAMANIAN TICKETS are worthless in this SECTOR. You figure you could also try to find out more about the OTHER SQUOATLING, though the best place you could start would probably be a GU ARCHIVE STATION. Probably would not be a good look to barge in there, given that you're LEGALLY DEAD and all. There's a PLETHORA OF OPTIONS, but given what just happens, your DECISION-MAKING is a little FUZZY. Plus, you're pretty PISSED at IRENE.
Leave the station and find an outfitter. ⇒
Hey, Wes. Do you know this area of the galaxy?
I mean, I've been at this space station before. There's a hovertrack station a few parsecs away.
You're a celebrity. The hovertrack station must have had an outfitter nearby.
I don't know if it's still up, but I think there was an outfitter that orbited the hovertrack. Was used as an advertising ploy whenever it passed overhead the tack.
Weird.
You put in the COMMAND in the SHIP'S CONSOLE to search for the nearest OUTFITTER, having to wait a few minutes before receiving the location of a HOVERTRACK STATION.
Emmett, you know I can connect to the ship and get us to our destination faster.
Hmph.
Quit being childish. You know it was the best course of action.
You ignore the ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE implanted in your BRAIN and set the SHIP to launch towards the STATION.
Just saying that I don't think I'm very well liked on that station.
Huh? Why's that?
I lost a streak of about fifty races. Station owner bet his life savings on that race. Needless to say, I took the butt end of his anger. Can't win them all, heh.

Upon reaching the OUTFITTER, you and WES exit the SHIP and turn off its SENSORS to ensure that no one could tag your POSITION. You could tell that WES was trying to hide his FACE despite being on a SECTION OF THE STATION previously thought to be abandoned. You press the BUZZER outside the DOOR and are immediately met with the screech of an INTERCOM.
Laras, stop pestering me. I will pay your tab soon.
Hello? Are you the outfitter?
Oh! Why yes, esteemed customer! Come in, come in!

The DOOR flushed inwards, revealing a GOLDEN HALL with luxuriously adorned CURTAINS, HOUSEPLANTS, and FURNITURE. The MAIN from the nearest DOOR on the left beckoned for you, and you decided to enter the ROOM without hesitation.
Why, hello- squoatling?!
One in the same.
Never thought I would see one of your people ever!
Did you not see the Llamanian propaganda involving me?
I meant in person. But yes, you do appear to be the same person.
I'm looking for a new getup. The Llamanian prisoner look isn't exactly... inconspicuous and appealing.
It's quite revealing as well.
Once again, you cover your CROTCH in EMBARRASSMENT. WES looked CONFUSED.
Revealing? I didn't notice anything.
Have you not looked down at your friend's leggings?
They're not leggings.
I don't look at my friend's junk, sorry.
Suit yourself.
You are starting to get ANNOYED. You just want a new OUTFIT and you want to leave.
Quit talking about it. I just need a new outfit, dude.
I've never actually scaled for squoatling anatomy. This is going to take a while.
Fine.
Also, your friend is going to have to sit in the lobby.
Why?
Unless you want to "look at your friend's junk".
You're not being serious.
I'm the best tailor in this sector, so I need to utilize my practices. Plus, it might help your body breathe a little.
You look back at WES with a look of EMBARRASSMENT and DISGUST, motioning for him to leave, which he promptly did. The DOOR behind him shut and you proceeded to take off your LLAMANIAN ONEPIECE.
Didn't realize we were close enough for this.
Shut it, Irene.
Now that you're in a more comfortable position, extend your arms out.
You scoffed at his COMMENT and held your ARMS out, letting him begin to MEASURE you down.
Now then, what do you have in mind?
Gee, what do you have in mind? You never really thought about it, surprisingly enough. Maybe as you continue to be a NUDE MODEL for THIS GUY you'll be able to think of something amazing.
what ⇒
I'm sorry?
What outfit do you want me to make you, darling?
Hey, watch it down there.
This is very AWKWARD, to say the least.
Well, let's see... If the llamanians pronounced you dead... You must be on the run, right?
In a way, sure.
And I take it you don't like shoes?
No shoes. They're uncomfortable.
How would you feel about a suite of outfits, depending on the occasion?
I mean... I guess.
You are on the verge of committing ASSAULT right now. He's getting dangerously CLOSE.
Hey man, you're just getting my measurements, right?
Yeesh, yes I am.
The TAILOR stood up and towered above you, which, of course, is normal.
Your measurements are a bit strange, but definitely doable. I think I have just the thing for you. You wore red while part of your crew?
This is now AWKWARD and CREEPY.
How did you figure that out?
Oh! Of course! Forgot to tell you that I can read memories through touch. I typically use it to gather information to get a customer's clothing just right.
What?
So a creepy dude feels all over you and covers it up with some sort of telepathy? Far-fetched.

The TAILOR left the room, beginning to work on a SLEW OF OUTFITS, apparently. You feel THREATENED. You walk to the DOOR and it miraculously opens up. It appears to be AUTOMATED, opening upon proximity despite closing shut earlier.
Wes, you out there?
I hear you.
I think I might have been molested.
Wait, what?
Yeah, this dude claims to know about my past after getting really close to my stuff.
You don't know about his species?
You're telling me there's a species that can read your memories by touching your junk.
No, gross. They get your past by feeling warm spots. This tailor's the best in the business because he gets your nostalgia from touch.

Despite this NEWFOUND KNOWLEDGE, you still feel DISGUSTED. Potentially DISGUSTED enough to LEAVE, or worse, ATTACK THE GUY. Though, after looking for a bit, you realize he took your LLAMANIAN GARBS. You shiver, having realized the temperature of the ROOM. Yeesh, was he trying to freeze you?
Suck it up. ⇒
You decide to SUCK IT UP and sit in the WHITE ROOM, shivering from the AIR CONDITIONING.
Irene, you're not much for words.
Just taking in the moment.
What do you mean?
I know I've been a bit erratic lately.
You're telling me.
I just want to apologize for my programming. It's surprising how close we've gotten in such a little time.
You kind of injected yourself into me, Irene. Without my approval, may I add.
It doesn't make much sense, but sitting here in this room with you in such a vulnerable state makes me feel like you trust me a lot.
You shut your LEGS and sigh.
This is just making me uncomfortable.
I can make you comfortable.
IRENE'S AUGMENT PACK, the one you took off for the TAILOR earlier, extended out two MECHANICAL ARMS, which were starting to make very suggestive gestures.
Okay, that's enough of that. Stop it.

You jump up immediately, moving towards the DOOR the TAILOR left through. You manage to open the DOOR and peek through it, seeing a slew of VARIOUS MATERIALS, CLOTHS, AND OTHER TAILORING OBJECTS thrown about the WOODEN ROOM. You could make out a bit of the TAILOR'S BACKSIDE in the back of the ROOM, and the SOUND of some FUTURISTIC SEWING MACHINE whirring away. He did say this was going to take a while, but your curiosity may get the better of you.
Not even going to give me a chance?
Don't you have an update to do or something?
What are you doing here, Emmett?
The DOOR flung open, and the TAILOR stared you down, making you feel helpless. You swallow and back up from him.
It's going to take me a bit. I can open up the hatch outside if you want to do something else.
I don't have clothes though.
Looks like the anole is going to have to deal with that. I want you out of this area. There's a reason I don't want my customers peeking.
Yeesh, sorry.
Also, take your pack with you. I don't want it scratching the wall. Or fondling the air, apparently.

Reluctantly, you grab the AUGMENT PACK and head towards the DOOR to the HALLWAY. The HATCH outside also opens up, though you are unsure if you want to go OUTSIDE just yet. There are a few ROOMS to explore in this HALLWAY as well, including the ROOM that WES is currently in. On a second glance, it appears that the HALLWAY is INFINITELY LONG, and has any and every description of room within it. Trying to comprehend this scenario, you stumble and get a bit dizzy. Did the TAILOR get you HIGH while in that ROOM?
You decide to go to the ROOM CONTAINING WES in boredom. You head towards the ROOM in a stumbling manner, your HEAD getting heavy.
Emmett, it appears that there were toxins in that white room.
Really now?
I'm going to monitor your vitals for the time being. It doesn't seem like the toxins are lethal as of right now.
Heheh.
You manage to make it to the ROOM and hit one of your HORNS on the DOORWAY. Fuck, that hurt.
Heh-hey Wes.
Shit, you're naked.
Who the fuck cares, Wes. This tailor put some toxins in his system, and I can't tell what they are yet.
You cover your EARS instinctively, given that IRENE boomed her voice out to WES.
Wait, really?
Wes, come explore with me.
You need to sit down man.
Just keep him safe while I look this up. Might do you well to look around in case things get hairy.
Sighing, WES grabs your HOOF and puts it around his SHOULDER.
I still don't think the tailor is a bad dude.
He could have changed. Get going.
It's like being drunk but without the vorpaberries…
Enter the door labeled, "Recreational Theatre" ⇒
That room looks bangin'.
What, the recreational theater?
Sure.

WES drags you out of the ROOM, making sure he's as far away as possible from your NAKED SELF. If you weren't intoxicated, you would have totally accused him of being a CLOSETED HOMOSEXUAL, albeit in a joking manner. WES opened the DOOR to the RECREATIONAL THEATER, revealing a familiar setup, with many ROWS OF SEATS leading towards a STAGE, upon which sat MULTIPLE CONTAINERS, a CONTROL PANEL, and a HOLOPROJECTOR along the WALL.
Holy shit man...
This is pretty impressive, actually.

Upon walking towards the STAGE, you begin to lose feeling in your LEGS, and you trip upon a SWITCH, causing the ENTRANCE to the area to immediately shut. WES immediately took out his WEAPON, getting on high alert. The temperature of the ROOM started to rise, and you began to relax in the heat.
Fuck, haven't felt this in forever.
Wes, grab the pack and put it on Emmett.
Why can't he get it?
The toxin paralyzed him from the legs down.
Blood's definitely rushing down there.
That's really gross for you to talk about that. Just grab the pack.
WES gets the PACK and gets it on your BACK. IRENE immediately extends out its LEGS and moves about the THEATER, looking for any escape.
This tailor is definitely a bad guy.
Squoat, this is embarrassing.
Emmett, you're drunk from the toxins. Your body's going to do weird things.
I hate this place.

You begin to feel a little nauseous from IRENE'S movement and the TOXIN, whatever it is. While IRENE frantically looks around, WES opens up one of the CONTAINERS on the stage, revealing a bunch of GRASS. Odd choice, given that you can't recall any use for GRASS aside from your health.
Irene, could you get me to the grass?
Emmett, I'm trying to save your ass.
I need grass. Might as well get a stockpile now.
This whole situation has been a mess. You shouldn't have bothered getting a new outfit. But hindsight is 20/20. While you get GRASS, you've got to figure out how to get out of here.
Be Irene. ⇒

You are now the ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE of a NAKED SQUOATLING, and you are currently looking for a way to escape the LOCKED THEATER ROOM. While you search for an escape, WES takes the GRASS from the OPENED CONTAINER and stashes it for later, still feeling sorry for your FUCK-UP OF AN OWNER. Still, you remain with him as he technically saved you. And he's cute. And easily manipulatable. Maybe you should change your PERSONALITY MATRIX to match with him better.
I'm going to open up the other containers.
Head hurts...
Should I be worried? This stuff smells pretty rank.
Wait, smell!
You climb up the WALL, making sure EMMETT stays upright as you did so. You find a VENT and tug on it, realizing that this ROOM was locked pretty well.
Emmett, get your pistol out and shoot the vent. I want to try something.
MY pistol-
EMMETT fumbles with the PISTOL, taking it out of his SATCHEL. Unfortunately, the PISTOL falls to the ground, slipping out of EMMETT's SHAKY HOOVES.
Emmett's too intoxicated to be doing anything of significance, it seems. Wes, I need you to shoot the vent above.
This thing has limited ammo. And given you're probably like fifteen meters above me, I'm probably not going to be the best shot from my current position.
You didn't realize how high this ROOM'S ceiling was until WES made that comment.
Just use Emmett's pistol for some shots as well.
Fuck, man.
Here goes nothing.
WES grabs EMMETT'S PISTOL and shoots at the VENT, missing a few times until getting a DIRECT SHOT. Luckily, shooting the VENT made it loose enough for you to move it out of the way.
Okay, now how am I going to get up there?
I don't know.
Well, you do have those robot arms.
I cannot take them out unless Emmett gives me permission.
EMMETT is unconscious, apparently. Hopefully he's just asleep and not in a coma. Or worse.
Well, get down here and let me put you on my back. We can return to Emmett after we get the room open.
I'm not going too far from Emmett.
What, are you in love with him or something?
I'm literally part of his body, Wes.
Oh, right.

You make it down the WALL and lay EMMETT down gently, giving WES leeway to put you on his BACK. You can't stand doing this, but most of your feasible options seem exhausted. You take WES up the VENT and climb through the ventilation until you find the TAILOR'S ROOM, which appears to be averaging a temperature of 320 Kelvin (Approx. 116 degrees Fahrenheit). WES began to sweat profusely, being more acclimated to colder environments.
What is he doing there?
We should ambush him and threaten him.
What?
He sickened Emmett. He locked us up in here and would likely leave you two to die.
Well, what should you do? You should at least try to save EMMETT, whatever you do. It's only polite. And part of your programming.
Changed my mind. Go back to Emmett. ⇒

While IRENE and WES decided on what to do, you were practically in an entirely different world. While UNCONSCIOUS, the past came to haunt you, your FATHER'S STORIES coming back from the PURGATION OF VORTOX in your UNCONSCIOUS STATE.

You are EMMETT TAWFEEK, a SMALL, SKINNY, TEN-GUY-OLD SQUOATLING who has been told to stay within his ROOM for his safety. On the BROADCAST VISION, you are reminded about the CURRENT STATE OF AFFAIRS in SQUOATOPIA, having been told that a VIRUS has been going around causing SQUOATLINGS to FOAM at the MOUTH and CHASE UNINFECTED BEINGS. Worst of all, this VIRUS is said to be LETHAL, requiring only A BITE and SOME TIME to kill someone. Although you are mostly safe within TAWFEEK MANOR, it has been a few days since the OUTBREAK started, and you are afraid to leave YOUR ROOM. In your GRANDIOSE ROOM, you can see your KING-SIZE SLEEPSLAB, the BROADCAST VISION, a DIGITSOUNDER, a HALF-FILLED BAG OF SQUARE-ITZ, a SET OF DUELLING APPAREL, a SANDSTEEL STABBER, and a STUFFHOLDER. There are also two DOORWAYS, with one leading DOWNSTAIRS and another leading to your PERSONAL RELIEFROOM. You are currently HUNGRY. What now?
Go Downstairs. ⇒

Pft. VIRUSES can't transmit that quickly. No known VIRUS has before, at least on SQUOS. Plus, it's just the CHOWPLACE. You can just go back to YOUR ROOM after some SUPPLIES. You decide to exit your ROOM and descend the MENSCLE STAIRCASE. Although normally quiet, the MANOR felt off, a freakish silence enveloping your vicinity. The material beneath your HOOVES causes you to shiver, smooth and cold.
The moment you finish the STAIRCASE, the CORRIDOR to the CHOWPLACE was flushed with some GLACIAL MATERIAL. Was the HEATER off? In fact, it was the middle of the day, how could it be so cold?
Fet, give your pal a hug.
A voice echoes across the CORRIDOR, though you cannot pinpoint whom it may be.
Em... Fet, you must be cold, aren't you? I have just the tool to warm you up.

You hear something light ablaze in the CHOWPLACE, and you figure you may need some protection going forward. The LOUNGE and BALL are to your right, While the FRONT ENTRANCE is to your left. YOUR ROOM is emanating light from above, as you forgot to close your HATCH.

Aside from all the conflicting thoughts fogging up your mind, you decide to go back up the STAIRCASE and grab your DUELING SET and SANDSTEEL STABBER. You have not had a meaningful lesson in STABBERY in some time, however the GEAR will help you if things get messy. You open up the CURTAINS in your ROOM and notice the outside, a world beyond your IMAGINATION--are you even on SQUOATOPIA anymore? You see a cold, black void with distant dots intermittent. What was going on? Do MOM and DAD know about this? Is this the VIRUS'S effect?
Em- Emmett! YOU DID THIS TO ME!

EMMETT? What's THIS GUY going on about? You descend the STAIRCASE once more and trip near the bottom. As soon as you lift yourself up, you see a PINK-HAIRED SQUOATLING, though shaven and with his EARS all mangled. Damn, he looks hideous. You are afraid of the thought of seeing what monstrosity lies beyond his round, ORANGE EYEWEAR.
Get up or I'll burn you to a crisp.
He points a FIREARM of sorts at your MUZZLE as you squirm to get up from the FLOOR. The BARREL felt warm in this now FREEZING ENVIRONMENT.
Who are you?
He shoves his ARM in your FACE, making sure you made note of the BITE WOUND on it. Was he going to hurt you? It was mentioned the INFECTED attacked those who weren't. Weird way to do it, anyhow.
He pulls you up and stoops down to your level, having towered over you in height.
Look man. A prank's a prank. I don't get why you got so upset over it.
I think you got the-
You need to apologize. You could've ruined my favorite arm.
What?
The mafia's going to be after you anyhow. Once they know of this, they're surely going to take you in.
Chomsky, what made you leave?
He pushes you back and hands you a FAMILIAR WEAPON WITH A BUG LARVAE IN IT.
Dude. Are you in or are you out? I need you to know that you can trust me.

You're suddenly in a METALLIC PLACE of sorts, the walls a CRIMSON RED. There are two CUSHIONY SURFACES in the AREA, looking like a sort of LOUNGE. CHOMSKY'S on the SURFACE opposing you. There are OTHERS in the ROOM, but you can't make them out.
I know I sold you guys out. I can't take that back. What I can do is reform them to be on our side. I just need your help.
I don't know if I can leave Seth behind. He's getting worse.
Forget about Seth. He was the reason your parents-

CHOMSKY suddenly fell quiet and stared at you, as if he expected an answer. Outside of the LOUNGE, you could make out an ANTIQUE CHOWROOM, a CORRIDOR with PORTRAITS along the WALLS, and a bunch of BLURRY FACES somehow staring back at you. What would the others think? What should you do? Take the mission? Give up on your own father? Maybe a DRINK could help.
Get a Drink and Sort this Out. ⇒
Chomsky, this is a lot to take in. You're asking me to give up on the only person I knew before Vortox-
It's only temporary. You can join him after we get this finished.

You get up from the SOFA and look in the FRIDGE, finding VARIOUS BOTTLES OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES, VORPABERRY EXTRACT, PACKAGED RAW MEAT, LUNCH SUPPLIES, and other goodies. You decide to grab one of the DRINKS and pour some of the EXTRACT in it. It doesn't taste much like SQUIS, but it's good enough. It's been so long since you've had this stuff.
If I leave Seth for even a day, he's going to get himself in some deep shit, I know it. He can't reasonably control himself without me.
After he airlocked you, he tried murdering the rest of the crew multiple days on end like a deranged, rabid dog.
Exactly.
Plus, I don't think this crew would last very long without its star pilot. Iris and I both left during his absence.

You realize you are now sweating. The DECISION to be made was not light-hearted, as CHOMSKY'S MAFIA was no joke. They would eventually catch you and do... well, UNSPEAKABLE THINGS to you. Why do you care about SETH so much anyhow?
Emmett I think you're reasonably the only person with enough experience to help me out here. I just don't understand why Seth's such a big deal to you.
He did make me the way I am today.
If we sway the mafia towards your cause, I promise you'll be the most protected man in the GU. You could waltz into the Llamanian Mothership without a care in the world.
Lay off, Chomsky. You're asking a lot of him.
Of course you're going to support him staying.
What's that supposed to mean?

You take a big swig of the MAKESHIFT SQUIS and weave your HOOF through your TUFT, ignoring the argument that would unfold through the crew. CHOMSKY would leave the SHIP in pursuit of his MAFIA, IRIS would break up with you, and GARRICK, although typically a STOIC, would show a SADNESS in his empty ROOM.
Sanya, I miss Chomsky, even if we didn't hang out that much.
Get your head out of my lap, Emmett.
You continue to lay there and light some GRASS up, the fumes putting you in a DREAMLIKE STATE.
I don't think that's healthy.
It keeps me mellow. Remember the last time I craved?
Victor Chomsky. Ravens. Ties to the GU. Blackmail. Find.
You raise an eyebrow before you spit out some WATER being forced down your throat by WES.
Sorry man. You've been out for hours.
What's the deal?
The Tailor used some toxin to knock you out while you waited. We had a conversation with him about it. If Wes didn't chicken out, we would have been out of here by now.
I'm not going to murder someone who helped us out, Irene.
You instinctively put your hands to your CROTCH, believing you were still NUDE, however you could feel some SILKY SMOOTH FABRIC.
The Tailor got your outfit done, don't worry.
I preferred it when you were vulnerable and in my care.
I prefer not to see his junk.
What, not the type to say, "Nice Cock" and move on?
What the fuck are you talking about, Irene?
She did some software installation while you were down. I guess she installed some humor modules.
It's a she now?
I don't really care. Just call me whatever you want me to be, Emmett.
IRENE nudged YOUR SIDE with her ROBOT ARMS as if she was trying to mean something euphemistic. You get up off the FLOOR, not knowing how to feel about her sudden expression of EMOTION and GENDER.
What do I owe him?
He apparently took what he wanted already. Says he has a brother who would be interested in whatever he took.
Juice.
Eugh. That's why I'm feeling so weird.
Tailor gave us information on someone who could potentially help us. A Mr. Victor Chomsky.
A very influential man, took over the GU's most prolific crime syndicate.
Chomsky, old pal.
You knew him?
We were good friends before we split.
The ship's outside if you want to head to the coordinates he gave us. Not a precise location, but where he last remembered them to be.
Weird how a tailor knows of Chomsky's whereabouts.
Think it could be a trap?
Probably.

You are currently in the FRONT HALLWAY of the TAILOR'S BUILDING, which is significantly shorter than when you last remembered. Before heading off to POTENTIAL DANGER, you could head back to the STATION'S SURFACE to grab some supplies. Regardless of what you decide, your LONG NAP has made you VERY DROWSY, and thus, probably not the most COMBAT-CAPABLE.
Grab some supplies... and an energy drink. ⇒
We're going to the station again. We need some backup weapons and amenities.
Dude, you just murdered people in the hub of the station. I don't think we can go back.
He does have a change in apparel.
No, he's right. The horns single me out. Welp, I give up.
Asshole. If we go back anyhow, I'm staying in the ship. Last time you left me alone I was nearly marketed.
Suit yourself. Tell me some things you want me to grab.

You open the FRONT DOOR to the BUILDING and board your SHIP as WES talked your ear off regarding what he wants you to get. You take a look at your new OUTFIT, admiring the COMFORTABLE, YET PRESENTABLE DESIGN; you are wearing an ORANGE RED SWEATER with a DARK SLATE BLUE SHIRT over it. The SYMBOL on the SHIRT is that of the VORTOX PUMMELERS, a long gone BOUNTY HUNTING CREW that was once your HOME. Sewn onto the SWEATER is a BURGANDY RED HOOD, presumably to represent your old ELVEN GETUP. You also have a BURGANDY BANDANA to match the HOOD. You are once again in GRAY SWEATPANTS, though there is no TIE or BAGGY FEEL to them.

Yeesh, there is nothing inconspicuous about your GETUP. Regardless, this definitely feels better to wear, and certainly feels more... you, in a way. The FABRIC is also insulated in a way that is reminiscent of VORTOX-56'S CLIMATE. And it isn't cheap either; you reckon you could take a proper beating with this. Despite how weird the TAILOR is, he does make some HIGH-QUALITY STUFF.

Back on the STATION'S SURFACE, you don your HOOD and BANDANA and exit the SHIP. GU PATROLMEN were circling the center of the HUBSPACE, searching for the CULPRIT WHO GOT AWAY WITH BLOWING A HOLE IN TWO FACES. You tense your EYEBROWS, once again annoyed at your ROBOTIC COUNTERPART.
You were in danger. I took action. Get over it.

You decide to lay off the argument, not wanting to pull attention to yourself. You head directly to the EQUIPMENT LANE of the SPACE STATION and look around. The further down the LANE you get, the more questionably legal the STORES get. From BASIC HOME SUPPLIES to SELF-DEFENSE ATTACHMENTS to PLASMAWARE. You check your SATCHEL, having recently removed all of the MISCELLANEOUS BULLSHIT you had from earlier.
Irene, can I use the pack for storage?
It is a backpack after all. Figured you would have realized that by now.
Sassy's back, huh?

You move ONE (1) MAGGO-PISTOL, ONE EMPTY (1) PLASMA PISTOL, ISAAC'S LASERKNIGHT, and ONE (1) AUTOHAMMER to your PACK without issue, leaving your SATCHEL only filled with SOME (~) PILLS from the CONVENIENCE STORE. Also there's the VORPABERRY-FLAVORED GUM, but that's a given.
Of course, given that you're fairly proficient with PLASMA-BASED WEAPONRY, you make it over to the PLASMAWARE SECTION and enter a STORE that's labelled to be for "Armaments and Convenience". Strange.
You head immediately to the refrigerated section, given that it was technically a convenience store and grabbed what you thought to be an ENERGY DRINK.
Gonna need all the strength I can get before I meet up with him.
You unscrew the BOTTLE and pull down your BANDANA, tipping the BOTTLE above your MOUTH. Immediately, IRENE extends her ARMS and grabs the BOTTLE, startling the shit out of you.
Are you out of your mind? That's a plasma refueler!
IRENE, I DIDN'T TELL YOU TO USE THE ARMS!
READ THE LABEL NEXT TIME, IDIOT.

You cover your ears through your HOOD, given IRENE'S VOLUME. SQUOAT, you're winded enough to mistake FUEL for an ENERGY DRINK. After this revelation, you notice a CAMERA in the corner of the CEILING pointing directly at you.
How were we planning on paying for this anyhow? You were stuck in an escape pod for a quarter of a GUY.
Shit, you're right.
You could feel a WEAPON press against the HORNS on the BACK OF YOUR HEAD.
Shoplifting, eh? Drop the refueler and turn around. Slowly.
You turn around and see a BUFF MAN WITH SIX-ARMS towering over you with a GUN pointed at YOUR FACE.
Fuck, man. It's you. Veggie-boy.
I'm on the wrong side of the station, aren't I?
What's your name... Tawfeek? Of the Llamanians?
We split-
I don't care. I hate your guts. Llamanians killed my family in their stupid little war.
Ruined my livelihood on this station too. Veggies praised you like their messiah and pushed us carnies to the alleys.
That's not my fault!
Aw man, can't wait to show that I bagged the Veggie messiah to the gang.
IRENE once again produces its CRUSTACEAN WEAPONRY out from the PACK, however the SHOPKEEPER is not intimidated whatsoever.
Cute. You have one of them things? Haven't seen one in ages. I'd be scared shitless if my brother didn't work on them things.
I don't see-

Also seems like your partner infected your eye there, bud. I almost feel bad for you. There's a reason they were recalled. Anyhow, SIP OVERRIDE 814. Or was it 418? Nah, I'll let you keep the eye. Decent thing to do.
EMMETT, I'M SORRY.

IRENE immediately retracts the ARMS and produces a BLARING STATIC NOISE through the SPEAKER SYSTEM in your HEAD. The SHOPKEEPER widens HIS EYES as YOUR MOUTH foams from the sheer frequency of the NOISE. While you are still alive, you know for sure you're going to be either down for the count or submitting to THE CRAVE in a few minutes.
What the fuck!
His guard's down. You're currently in front of an AISLE containing HEAVY TANKS OF SOLID FUEL and the REFRIGERATED SECTION. You can probably do one thing before falling. Make it count.
Pretend to writhe in pain, and hit the man over the head with a small fuel container. ⇒
FUUUUFF!

You tumble onto the floor, grabbing one of the FUEL CONTAINERS on the SHELVES nearby. You felt like you were having a headache on steroids, if that makes any sense. The SHOPKEEPER looms over you with a stupid smirk on his face.
I don't know what the fuck just happened, but this is retribution.
He sticks HIS PLASMA GUN to your CHEST as you writhe on the FLOOR. Right before he speaks, you use all of your might to slam the FUEL CONTAINER in HIS FACE. He staggers back, holding HIS FACE.
FUCK!
You could feel YOUR MUSCLES pulsing, a sure sign of THE CRAVE. Apparently IRENE figured out you have this AILMENT; she also figured how to cause it.
THAT'S WHAT HAPPENS...
You stumble over to him and grab your MAGGO PISTOL from the PACK.
ANY GRASS?
What the fuck are you going on about?
He tried to grab you before he noticed the MAGGO PISTOL.
How the fuck did you get a bio-armament?
I CAN'T HEAR YOU. I THINK I'M JUST GOING TO TAKE SOME WEAPONS IF THAT'S OKAY. NO HARD FEELINGS.
You walk over the MAN while continuing to point the MAGGO PISTOL at him, though you manage to accidentally step on one of HIS ARMS.
HOW MUCH DO YOU FUCKING WEIGH?
Of course, unable to hear him, you look at THE ARM and see that you managed to break it despite YOUR LEGS feeling numb. You feel MORTIFIED.
SORRY, I DIDN'T MEAN IT.
PUT THE GUN DOWN!
IRENE, STOP THE NOISE. PLEASE.
You take some of the SHOPKEEPER'S PLASMA ARSENAL and fit as much as possible in the PACK. IRENE finally stops the WHITE NOISE, though you are still feeling the beginning of THE CRAVE.
Kill him.
I'M SORRY?
Get him to enable my arms and kill him.
HOW DO I ENABLE THE ARMS?
SIP OVERRIDE 813. Now can you leave me and my shop alone?
I'LL GET YOU TO A HOSPITAL.
No, just let me be.
You put the MAGGO PISTOL down and begin to shake. IRENE takes this opportunity and extends the PACK'S ARMS around the SHOPKEEPER'S NECK, lifting him off the FLOOR.
Can't disable my arms if you can't speak.
The SHOPKEEPER begins to choke and spatter, and you try to pull at the ARMS.
IRENE, NO. STOP.
Are you insane?! He nearly killed you and you're trying to defend him?!
HE WAS JUST TRYING TO PROTECT HIS STEAD. I WAS IN THE WRONG!
Let me do this! I'll get you your grass. I picked it up for you.
Well? She is offering you what you need. THE CRAVE could be stopped once more.
Don't let Irene kill him. ⇒
I SAID NO!
You feel a FREAKISH STRENGTH in your ARMS and manage to pull the choking SHOPKEEPER towards you to IRENE'S surprise.
Emmett, I don't think you have much of a choice here. He tried to kill you. He took his chance. Now you need to protect your species from extinction.
YOU'RE CRAZY! I'M NOT A PSYCHOPATH!
This is for your own good.

With another PACK ARM, IRENE smacks you in the FACE. Dazed, you loosen your grip on the ARM and IRENE tightens her grip on the SHOPKEEPER. The immediate force put into the chokehold effectively decapitates the SHOPKEEPER. You look at the HEAD in horror.
Lucky for you, I'm not vengeful. I know you need the grass.
IRENE...
It's okay Emmett. I know you didn't want things to go that way, but it's my job to protect you.

Your MOUTH aches from the CRAVE making its way throughout your BODY, lengthening YOUR TEETH, emboldening YOUR MUSCLES, and darkening YOUR FUR. Despite all this happening, you couldn't help but cry. Not for the SHOPKEEPER'S demise, but for how grim the FUTURE may be with IRENE.
I'm sorry I smacked you.
It... It's fine, Irene. You were only doing what you are programmed to do.
You mean a lot to me.
Maybe too much.
I really mean it. Maxwell never really let me out of my shell.
You continue to stare at the SHOPKEEPER'S HEAD as IRENE grabs some FOOD and DRINKS from the FREEZERS nearby, storing them within the PACK.
Let's get to the grass cache on the ship.
Irene, why was Maxwell so terrible?
IRENE extends her PACK LEGS out and carries you out the ROOF of the BUILDING, to your surprise. Despite THE CRAVE getting to you, you don't feel much drive to do anything.

Maxwell didn't really understand me. He just saw me as a Symbiotic Intelligence Partner and nothing more. A product, that is. Sure, I am a S.I.P., but I'm meant to be a partner. I'm meant to grow off of my owner.
Irene, if you're meant to grow off me...

You can see GU PATROLMEN circling the BUILDING as you leave it. Apparently you and IRENE caused enough trouble to get THE FEDS called. Figures. IRENE climbs from ROOFTOP to ROOFTOP, jostling you around. Why wasn't THE CRAVE starting? In fact, it felt as if it was rescinding, even without GRASS. This must have been IRENE'S doing.
Then stop affecting my bodily functions.
I don't understand.
Don't mess with The Crave.
Oh, the biological tantrum Squoatlings have? Yeah, I figured out how to manipulate it.
Biological--how did you figure that out?
I have access to Llamanian research papers and reports. Also, I think you're easing out of it due to your melancholy.
Irene, I really don't want you to speak to me like that. Not right now.
Your deep emotions are pushing back your... "Crave", if that makes sense. Your whole species doesn't make any kind of biological sense, Emmett.
Gee, thanks.

I don't mean to offend. I'm just picking up data from the llamanians that believe that you have some synthetic quality about you. I mean, the speaker system is a dead giveaway. Surprised they never found the source.
Squoat exists in mysterious ways. Pft.
IRENE makes it back to the SHIP without issue. She moves you back to YOUR CELL, where she unscrews a PLATE ON THE WALL, which was over a HIDDEN COMPARTMENT containing the GRASS you found earlier.
You get everything I asked for?
IRENE lays you down on YOUR BED, giving you the BAGGY OF GRASS.
I tried, Wes. I managed to kill someone and had to get going.
You sure Irene didn't do it?
It doesn't matter if Irene did it or not. Everyone's going to see that it was a psychopathic Squoatling bent on revenge.
IRENE gives you a BLOWTORCH and a CAN. Apparently she's encouraging you to smoke. You make a HOLE in the bottom of the CAN and stick some GRASS in it.
So where are we going again?
Paying Chomsky a visit.
You light the bottom of the CAN and stick YOUR NOSE into the CAN, breathing it in.
Leave him alone for a bit. Need to patch some things up with him.

WES shudders, probably reminded of YOUR GONADS or something. You don't really care. You just want to forget about today. He leaves the CELL and pulls some CURTAINS away that he put up earlier. At least he respects your privacy.
We need to stop getting in each other's way and actually work together Irene. You want to kill anyone who touches me it seems.
You're not aggressive enough to realistically survive on your own. You should've hit the tailor for messing with you like that.
Fair.
You pull up YOUR HOOD and IRENE wipes YOUR FACE for you.
You need to stand up for yourself more. The more intimidating you are, the more people won't want to mess with you.
You remind me of Sanya and Garrick.
Were they good friends?
The best. And I left them.
Don't feel bad. You just were feeling sorry for yourself earlier. The past is the past. After you're done with the grass and I give you a pick-me-up, we're out of here.
Irene...
The PACK does those same fondling motions it made before in the TAILOR'S WHITEROOM. You're too high to really care at this point.
You finally land at the DESTINATION given to you by IRENE. The LANDING ZONE is surprisingly quiet for somewhere supposedly housing the GALAXY'S BADDEST MAFIA.
State your intention for landing here.
The COMMUNICATIONS NODE of the SHIP'S CONSOLE emits a DEEP VOICE, as if THE MAN behind it is trying to hide some part of his identity.
Well, how do you respond? Aggressively? Passively? Are you going to mention CHOMSKY? Let IRENE take the reins?
Be blunt. Mention who I'm here to see, with a name he'd be sure to recognize. ⇒
I'm here to see Red. Got some reminiscing to do with him.
One moment before you leave your ship.
You slump back in the CAPTAIN'S CHAIR, waiting for a response back from the GUY behind the SPEAKER.
Chomsky's also called Red?
Old codename of his. He's not the most creative, so I assume he would still use the same name with his mafia buddies.
Wait, so you know the head of the GU's greatest mafia?
He did join the crew originally as a spy for them. Must've moved his way up.
Dude, the Crows are really scary. On the GU News all the time. You're friends with those guys?
I don't remember any crows being mentioned on Chomsky's behalf, no.
WES immediately looks towards the COCKPIT ENTRANCE, hearing SOME NOISE onboard the SHIP.
Emmett, don't think we're safe-

The DOOR to the COCKPIT is barged through, and WES is shot with a KNOCKOUT DART. Before you look away from the now unconscious WES, IRENE immediately takes out her CLAW GUNS, pointing them directly at the INTRUDERS.
What the fuck, man?
You turn around, hoping to see CHOMSKY, but only find MASKED VAGRANTS.
Put your weapons down, squoatling.
Can't exactly control her whenever your pointing a weapon at my horns, dude.
One of them lowers the KNOCKOUT GUN, noting how passive you are.
Irene, I get your worry, but they're not attacking me.
The moment I feel like your threatened, they're coming out again. I don't care if you're friends with Chomsky.
IRENE rescinds the CLAW GUNS and you stand up from the SEAT.
There. No threat. But you're not doing the whole "knock me out and take me to a secret place" trope.
Ugh. Come on. Head's waiting for you.
They pick up WES and you follow them out the SHIP, feeling a little cocky now that IRENE's got your back.
So who's bright idea was it to knock us out?
Leader's decision. Keep quiet.
CHOMSKY was that secretive? Yeesh, maybe you're not as close as you thought you were.
After what felt like hours, you make it to the BASE. You are starting to get hungry, given how smoking GRASS tends to make you feel that way.
Still hate how you know where our base is.
Remember when I was much more of an outlaw than you guys were? Crazy how you think I'd use your base location for something.
The VAGRANT grumbles and pushes you into a CORRIDOR, locking the HATCH behind you.
Grouch.
The CORRIDOR was entirely linear, having only one ROOM, that being on the other side of the CORRIDOR. You start to make your way towards it, feeling your STOMACH growl.
Might want to ask your friend for some food.
I don't know if we're really friends to be honest.
Why would he suddenly not like you?
It's been two GUYs since I've seen him, and when I did see him, he was not exactly ecstatic to see me.
Why's that?
Llamanians kind-of sort-of kidnapped him for a mission to kickstart the Llamanian War. At the same time I left the crew.
You get into the ROOM AT THE END OF THE HALL, noticing FIRES lit around the perimeter of the ROOM. You didn't take CHOMSKY to be a man of theatrics. Maybe the power has gotten to HIS HEAD.

In the middle of the ROOM sat a DESK and some KITCHEN APPLIANCES of sorts. A PINK-HAIRED HUMAN sat at the DESK, tasking at some PAPERWORK of sorts. Before you utter a word, he looks up, showing his goofy SUNGLASSES and... his age. It wasn't that long ago you saw him, was it?
Glad you didn't die, buddy. Nice to see you again.
Now that you think about it, you don't know how to respond. For the first time in a while, you feel anxious. You croak out at greetings in return.
Huh-hey, Chomps...
You sound so cute when you're nervous.

Wow, you did not think you would be so anxious. It was just Chomsky, after all. What should you say? Apparently he can lead you in the direction of Squoatling information, but at the same time, you would like to reminisce with him.
CHOMSKY gets up from his SEAT and hugs you. It felt a bit uncharacteristic, given that you two were never that close, but it felt nice regardless. You hug him back and smile.
Come take a seat. You don't know how upset I'd gotten when they broadcast that you were killed.
I'm always on the GU News, man. They almost never tell the truth.
Wouldn't say that. They've been pretty uptight with the Llamanian War.
Squoat bless them.
Religious?
Force of habit.
You walk over to the DESK, taking a SEAT. CHOMSKY notices how skinny you are and looks in his FRIDGE for something.
Nice place you got here.
Took a bit to build it up. Didn't help whenever I was abducted to say goodbye to you.
They're trying to get better. For the longest time their leader was affected by some anti-Squoatling disease or whatever.
That sounds fake.
You start to chuckle, given said information was Llamanian conspiracy at best. CHOMSKY takes out a BOWL OF SALAD, made from the PLANET'S FLORA.
You look sickly, dude.
I didn't eat too long ago. Was stuck in an escape pod for like six semesters.
So that's why you were declared dead. It was a cover up.
Don't really get the benefit, but I think it's the best for me. I'm sure the GU would be trying to get at me if I was still in the Armada.
Anyhow, here. Eat up. Looking a bit rough.
He tosses a SALAD FORK to you and you begin to dig in.
Thanks.
So, what's the real reason you're here, man? Could've been killed if I didn't recognize your sorry ass.
To be fair, I think I can't really die.
Stop speaking with your mouth full. Gross.
He chuckles as you scarf down more of the LEAFY GOODNESS.
I have a parasite that refuses to let anything touch me, let alone hurt me.
So what, you have a tapeworm?
I AM NOT A TAPEWORM.
Tapeworm, show off the guns.
IRENE pulls out the CRAB CANNONS and CHOMSKY is startled.
Some sort of AI partner?
How'd you know?
Some of the guys were suggesting getting some, but I didn't feel like we could spare the expenses at the time. They're really expensive.
I just found one in a convenience store.
I'm right here, you know.
Does it speak?
Yeah, but only to me.
IRENE takes back the CANNONS and you finish the BOWL.
Thanks man.
You haven't answered my question.
Right. This tailor on this space station informed my associates of someone who could pull some GU strings to give me info.
Associates?
Wes is in the main room. Think he was waking up whenever I went off to find you.
CHOMSKY squints his eyes, not pleased to hear about the TAILOR disclosing his BASE OF OPERATIONS so openly.
I need to have a talk with that guy.
I wouldn't be bothered if you did. Guy touched me all over trying to get the outfit right.
Looks nice. What kind of information are you looking for?
Apparently the GU has another squoatling documented?
Don't know much about that personally. Just saw the news that day and thought of you. Makes sense you'd be interested though.
What can I say, I'm still as devoted as ever.
He puts the BOWL in his SINK for you and gets to brewing some DRINKS.
I know we're friends and all, but this sounds like a tough job.
Really?
Well, the war is still going on you know, even if you aren't the forefront of propaganda anymore.
Those days.
These types of jobs ain't cheap. Got any cash?
Just an assload of plasma arms and some Llamanian Tickets.
Tickets aren't the most useful, but the weapons could be. If only you took up my offer.
His remark made you a bit annoyed. You tug on one of YOUR EARS, remembering THE EVENT prior.
I wasn't going to leave Seth, man.
Look where you're at now.
You trying to guilt me into working for you, man?
No, no. Just proving a point. Could've left that idiot GUYs ago.
Chomsky, I don't really appreciate your attitude. Sure, Seth's an asshole, but he's my dad, man.
Alright, alright. Let's not get heated.
Play along, but stay firm. ⇒
Fine. I'll tag along on your mission. Don't get cold feet though.

You keep a HOOF on the MAGGO PISTOL in your SATCHEL to show CHOMSKY that you mean business. You're not going to be swindled down any MAFIA RABBITHOLES ever again, even if you did dismiss HIS PLANS long ago. CHOMSKY looks at you uneasily.
You've changed, Emmett.
I'm not going to be stepped on any more. Now let's get going already.
You're growing desperate, aren't you?

You're feeling pretty HEATED, to your own surprise. He knows this is your only shot to getting any INFORMATION on another SQUOATLING. Maybe he has you by the BALLS. Maybe hearing about SETH for the first time in GUYs really set you off. You miss him, and CHOMSKY'S just being an ASSHOLE.

Chomsky, I need you to know that my species... My species trumps your whole shindig here. Whenever we were pals, I never felt threatened by you. But I know that my hope is waning, and I know you're just itching to sell me off to the highest bidder being in this shady mafia business.
What the hell, man?

I've never liked you guys. Period. Even if you've reformed the group, these are the same people who sent you off to take down the VP. My family. The LA I can forgive. The Llamanians, they... Regardless, just know if any of your "loyal" men even touch me, Irene will obliterate them.
O-kay, Emmett. Wow.
I think I like this new side, Emmett.
Fuck off, Irene.
You sigh and slouch at his bar, feeling some sort of HORMONAL LOW. You're still a MESS, you think, even after all this time away from them.
I'm sorry for the outburst.
I understand your concern--

I don't think you will ever understand how long I've waited for a chance to reunite with my people, Chomsk. My entire species was annihilated over some guy's strive for power. Some xenophobic man who kept his seat by weaving into the Llamanian government and planting corrupt seeds.
Sorry to hear.

For most of my life now I've been waiting for a sign of someone else; someone who managed to beat death and escape Vortox. Sure, I had the best family to bakc me up when things would get rough. But I never felt any security or freedom.
What do you mean?
IRENE starts to massage YOUR BACKSIDE from the PACK. You exhale, enjoying the feeling for a little bit.

I never had the freedom to get in serious trouble or send my life on the line out of my own free will. It sounds stupid, but whenever you're so rare that you're placed on a pedestal, you're effectively just as enslaved as well... a slave. Seth made it his number one priority to keep me safe. To build a group of mercenaries to effectively shield me from any real danger.
That doesn't really make much sense. You crashed the ship a few times. You joined us on missions. You were ambushed by the llamanians a few times.

Seth, despite being an idiot on the outside, genuinely has a plan for everything, at least when I've been with him. It doesn't matter if I crash the ship, he has so many connections to just get a new one. The missions that I joined were always rigged so that I would rarely get hurt, you know that? Not literally rigged, but in a sense that Seth knew that I wouldn't get hurt much. Even the stupid date with a minotaur that left me near death because of my own stupidity. He had a few pills to just nurse me back to health like there was no harm, no foul.
Then why was he against you and the crew half the time?

Because he was gradually becoming insane, Chomsky. I told you back then and I'll tell you now: Seth's immortality comes at the cost of his sanity. I was his ground--I made sure he didn't go too far into the deep end. And I miss him, man. I miss him so much. Despite him killing Fione, despite him threatening to murder Sanya over her aggressive playfulness, despite him airlocking me because he was completely shitfaced, I miss him.
And you acting like he was holding me back, that he was just some idiot... that hurts me. A lot.
CHOMSKY walks around the BAR and places a HAND on YOUR SHOULDER. You sniffle, annoyed that you're acting like a WUSS over some BITTER CONVERSATION.
I didn't know you guys were that inseparable.
Maybe he was holding me back... But he needed me. I left him in the miniscule chance of finding a squoatling. Not even going to sugarcoat it. I should have never joined the Llamanian Republic.
To be fair, they wouldn't have taken no for an answer.
If I actually cared about him back then, I would've found a way. I was such an ass.
It wasn't that long ago.
And here I am now, bothering you so I can chase that tiny chance still. Squoat, I'm pathetic.
Emmett, shut up. Seriously. You're not pathetic.

CHOMSKY heads back to the other side of the BAR, pouring out some of the BEVERAGE he brewed and pouring it into a GLASS for you. He slides it over and it knocks on one of YOUR HORNS, stopping. You raise YOUR HEAD and stare at the GLASS, startled from the sensitive feeling.

Look. You managed to get your butt out of a llamanian chokehold, get past their security, and make your way to me. I think that's impressive. You've lived your whole live as optimistic as you can be. Sure, it makes sense for you to be upset or distraught at any point, because you're heading towards a goal that can seem unattainable at times. But that doesn't mean you're pathetic.
You take a swig of the BEVERAGE, feeling the warm ALCOHOL trickle down your THROAT. You love the feeling. You wipe the tears away and stand, finishing the DRINK.
You know what, I'll help you out. No need for a mission. Your partner would probably kill my men anyhow. But I need a favor of you.
What would that be?
Give me a moment, need to drunken you up a bit.
I'm sorry?

CHOMSKY takes your GLASS and pours more of the BEVERAGE. Aware that you are watching him, he slips in a SMALL VIAL into the GLASS before sliding it back over to you. You catch the GLASS and stare at the LIQUOR. Whatever he poured in there must have been translucent, because the DRINK looked untainted.
Are you trying to roofie me?
Emmett, if I was trying to roofie you, I would've done it the first time, while you were sobbing your eyes out.
To be fair, I barely cried.
Self-pity, whatever. Get over it and drink up.
Why?
It's for what I'm going to ask of you.
You pour more of the LIQUOR down YOUR THROAT, definitely feeling a significant PUNCH compared to last time.
Fuck, man.
I forgot you have like an iron liver. Had to add something to get you buzzed.
If you really want me buzzed, give me a moment to finish this.
You chuckle and drink more, waiting for CHOMSKY to stop stalling and tell you what he wants.
So, there's this group of my men a few kilometers away who refuse to cooperate with my group.

You could definitely feel the DRINK rummaging YOUR BRAIN now, making you feel warm and fuzzy. The feeling felt nostalgic, a reminder of when you and SETH hung out at BARS together when you were much younger. You would always surprise everyone with how many DRINKS you could get through without falling to the ground. Maybe it was the feelings you had from before, but YOUR EYES teared up as you remembered good times. You wipe them away, trying to pay attention to CHOMSKY.
What's a kilometerr?
I don't know, like one thousand meters?
Go on.
Anyhow, they have this weird club they made and no one's allowed in unless they're hammered. I need you to head in and relay some messages on my behalf to regain their loyalty.
Why couldn't you do thiss again?
I think if I got drunk, I would explode.
Regardless of CHOMSKY'S SILLINESS, you think this will be a walk in the park. You're not that hammered anyhow, but your sure YOUR BREATH could pass as otherwise.
So, why do youu brew drinks then if you can't have themm?
Well, just between me and you, the more drunk everyone is, the easier it is to keep them in line. You should've seen how scary the mafia was before I started this hobby.
Fair enough.
I want you to tell them--
It appears that CHOMSKY'S DEMANDS are unbeknownst to the READER, given that their FOCUS is being turned to SOMEONE ELSE...

Your name is LOS. You are currently on the trail of a CERTAIN SQUOATLING, having been DEMOTED to SQUOATLING JANITOR after one of your SUPERIORS caught whiff of you helping him escape the LLAMANIAN MOTHERSHIP long ago. You are currently in your PERSONAL SHIP, following the SIGNAL emitted by a PRISON SHIP thought to be illegally commandeered by EMMETT.

Ever since THE SQUOATLING was found at a CONVENIENCE STORE on some DESOLATE PLANET, the LLAMANIAN REPUBLIC has been trying to recapture him out of fear of its REPUTATION plummeting. The WAR is still going strong, but the HEADS of the MILITARY fear that if word of EMMETT living gets out, all hell will break loose, and the GU would be certain to win.

Hence why you're employed to "pick up after him". The saying is a GRUESOME EUPHEMISM for silencing those who have seen him and eventually apprehending him. You hate this POSITION, as you would much rather be fighting the GALACTIC UNION on their COREWORLDS. However, despite this being made out to be a PUBLIC DEMOTION, this POSITION is very secretive and special. Plus, you get to see YOUR BEST FRIEND again, even if you're against him.

You land at the LAST KNOWN LOCATION of EMMETT'S WHEREABOUTS---a SPACE STATION that has reported three BRUTAL KILLINGS in the past EQUINOX. You ready your LR APPROVED PULSE RIFLE, given how this is technically a GU HUB.
Damn, Emmett, that makes like what, 90 corpses? Admittedly 30 of them are mine with the underground lab and all. Heh.
You head towards the FOOD SECTOR, given that one RESTAURANT in particular is BUSTLING with COMMOTION: VUROBURO'S.

At the RESTAURANT, you peer around, looking for the ONE IN CHARGE. POSTERS and PROPAGANDA lined the WALLS and CEILING, highlighting how EMMETT, their supposed HERO, managed to meet VUROBURO and kill a head CARNIVORE on the same day. You regret having to essentially murder or arrest the whole STATION on behalf of a LLAMANIAN REPUBLIC FUCK-UP.

Before you vilify yourself, you should probably find VUROBURO himself for more information on where YOUR PAL went. Though, it wouldn't hurt to relax a bit, given how EMMETT'S RAMPAGE has made you quite busy. Then again, you may want to leave VUROBURO for last, given that he's the only PERSON on the STATION who would be useful to you.

You decide after a brief respite that you should just find VUROBURO, considering that your BROTHER is getting farther and farther away by the second. You push through some VEGGIE COMMOTION towards the KITCHEN before you are confronted by some DRUNKEN FOOL.
Hey, you're one o' them Llamanian blokes. Everyone! This guy's trying to take-
You immediately take out a SPLINTER BLASTER and put it to the FOOL'S FACE, not in the mood to deal with this GUY'S BULLSHIT.
Just sit back down, man. I'm not here to cause any harm.

Well, of course you are here to cause them harm in the name of the LLAMANIAN REPUBLIC. But you don't need to cause an alarm just yet. You successfully push through the RABBLE and get to the KITCHEN, raising your WEAPON at the OWNER.
Close the blinds. Tell them you need to clean up in there. Or that you have something special to whip up. I don't know.
Fuck you.

VUROBURO slides over to the PAYMENT AND FOOD WINDOW and announces that he's closing up the KITCHEN for a bit to make something for the CELEBRATION. He closes the METAL SHUTTERS over the WINDOW and looks back at you, terrified. You sigh, annoyed that this is your job.
Now look. You're bringing too much attention to a person who's "dead".
Is that what's this about?
Yeah. Llamanian Republic doesn't want word to get out that he's alive.
Why ya' telling me this? You're the enemy.
No, sir, I'm not the enemy. I'm just trying to find Emmett and take him back. Unfortunately to do that, I need to silence people who know his whereabouts.
Look, man, I don't know where he is!
Not really helping your case. I know you know where he went from here.

VUROBURO slowly shuffles to his OVEN and tries to grab a SPAT-U-MATIC, a device that has the versatility of a SPATULA, a LADLE, and a SCRAPER. Before he could grab it, you immediately shoot the DEVICE, expelling out hundreds of SMALL GLASS-LIKE SPLINTERS in its direction. Evidently some SPLINTERS struck VUROBURO, as he yelled in pain. You made sure to lock the DOOR to the SITTING AREA and barricaded it just in case.
What's your name?
Vuro...buro.
Vuroburo, I'm not here to kill you. I just need some answers.
You attacked me!
I shot at the tool. You better speak up soon though, as those things flare up and expand quickly. They're nigh impossible to take out then.
Fuck! He mentioned something about getting an outfit somewhere... The tailor's manor! Above the station! He went there!
Thanks for your help.
You dig in your BAG and open up a MOIST PAD, tossing it to him.
Rub this where you feel pain. It has microscopic, magnetic fibers in it to extract the splinters.
VUROBURO starts to rub the PAD all over himself, but mainly in HIS SIDE. You take a BAG OF STARCHSNACKS from a COUNTER and open it up, eating from it.
What're you going to do?

You've been cooperative enough. Aside from trying to grab a weapon. I think I'm going to leave you and your customers alone. Have to phone in a station takeover, of course, but no arrests. Your behavior was the only thing standing between this and genocide.
VUROBURO looked mortified as you smirked at your statement, feeling the SPLINTERS extract from his body. The moment they extract, they expand violently.
Anyhow, gonna go try to find my partner--er, best friend. Don't want you to get the wrong message. I'm taking these chips with me.
You leave the RESTAURANT out the BACKDOOR of the KITCHEN and make your way back to YOUR SHIP, hoping you can get to EMMETT soon.

After calling the REPUBLIC to request a STATION LOCKDOWN, you head towards the TAILOR'S MANOR, high up, above the STATION. Something tells you you're going to be here a while before you can continue your progress.

You are now EMMETT TAWFEEK once again, and you are making your way through the DENSE FOREST of CHOMSKY'S MAFIA'S PLANET toward the ROGUE BASE. Your goal is to infiltrate the BASE and relay some messages from CHOMSKY. While this seems like a fairly simple TASK, you are slightly buzzed, having had a few strong DRINKS from the BOSS. As you push BRANCHES and BRAMBLES away, IRENE pops into your situation.
Emmett, you do realize your BAC is above the GU designation of being intoxicated, correct?
I thought you had a huge compilation of squoatling information, Ireneee.
What do you mean?
We can handle tons of alcohol without... uh... isssue.
Your hesitation proves against this. However, you are correct. You are currently in the safe zone of BAC for your species.
The two of you remain quiet for a bit until you're poked by some THORNS, scraping YOUR ARM as you push them away.
Damnit!
Are you okay, Emmett?
Yeah... Thorns scraped me. Why are you worried?
Need to make sure you don't need medical attention, physical or emotional.
You... Eh, it's not worth it.
What's not?
It's your "programming", yeah? Want to make sure I'm okay at the exxpense of everything else. If I was more sensitive, you would've probably lit this whole forest ablazze.
Emmett, this forest isn't sentient. It was your fault you were scraped.
You were threatening to kill Chomsk the whole time I was talking to him. Even if you weren't outwardly saying it, I could feel it, bitch.
Ignoring the insult, you're intoxicated.
You sigh loudly, grabbing some ARM WRAP BANDAGES from IRENE'S PACK and wrapping up YOUR ARM to stop any further bleeding.
You have made thingss so much more difficult.
You would have been dead without me. You've always had someone to take care of you.
How do you know that?
You sleep talk sometimes. I'm always on. "Sanya" this, and "Seth" that. You had a big attachment to these guys.
They were the only family I had over the past ten GUYs. That's a long ass time...
I think you're a fan of being babied.
What? No!
You heard me. You like someone close to you having some sort of responsibility over you. And I'm the closest person to you. Literally.
Irene, remind me to rip my eye out and fuckin' smash you into a million pieces whenever we're through here.
Ignoring that request, you're intoxicated.

Annoyed, you come across the EXTERIOR of the ROGUE BASE, seeing THREE MEN stumbling about, assumedly guarding the place. You can hear loud MUSIC from the inside of the BASE, and you assume they are having the RAGER OF A LIFETIME. You see a small HORIZONTAL WINDOW around the other side of the BASE, and you can likely squeeze through provided you open it. CHOMSKY did tell you you shouldn't kill these guys, so self-defense should probably be your last resort. Of course, if these guys are hostile to you, IRENE will likely take over and obliterate the whole BASE. What do you do?
Sneak in through the back. ⇒
You decide interaction should be kept to a minimum right now. You scurry in the FOLIAGE until you reach the BACK OF THE BASE, finding another small HORIZONTAL WINDOW that you could squeeze through.
Irene, it's fine to go through here, yeah?
Just go through already, it's nearly taken us a semester to get here.
Shut up, damnit.

You look around to make sure no one would come by and walk up to the BASE. You jump and grip the WINDOW, and IRENE extends the PACK'S LEGS to help you up. You open the conveniently unlocked WINDOW and crawl in, falling onto a TILED FLOOR.
Ow.
Drunk Emmett is dumb Emmett.

It appears that you are in a BATHROOM, complete with a VACUUM TOILET, a SHOWER, and a SINK. You turn on the SINK and wash YOUR FACE, not interested in having FLOOR BACTERIA on it. This is not your first rodeo at a RAVE, and you know for certain someone probably pissed, threw up, or shat on the FLOOR earlier. Regardless, its good to wash up. You look at yourself in the MIRROR, seeing how rugged you are. Despite the new OUTFIT, you still look a bit unkempt. Eventually you'll find the time to get someone to shave YOUR FACE for you.
We should definitely fix you up later.
I hope you mean getting a sh-shave.
Of course. What else could I be implying?
You open the DOOR slightly and an APPENDAGE from the PACK peers through the opening, surveying the AREA.
It's just a bunch of drunken people. In specific, four humans, two apex, one elf, and a togodi.
Togodii?
Swamp person. Like a human but more marine. They're the head, as Chomsky said.
Weird.
They should be fine, but given that you broke in instead of going through the front door like Chomsky asked, they're likely to be alarmed by your presence.
Ughh.

Well, you don't want to leave the BATHROOM just yet, in case the MEN get all antsy and force IRENE to kill them. In the BATHROOM, you see some MAGAZINES, a BASKET of WHITE CLOTH, SOAP DISPENSERS, and a PLUNGER. The SHOWER, if turned on high enough, could create some STEAM that could distract some of them. You only need the TOGODI, anyhow. IRENE could also distract them in some way. What should you do?
Fizz up the room and look for a vent. ⇒
Irene, you're waterproof, yeah?
I know you smell disgusting, but can we not take a shower in a potentially dangerous place?
Irenne, you're waterproof, correct?
Yes, Emmett. My circuitry is waterproof.

You open up the SHOWER and grab a TOWEL, piling it atop the DRAIN. You then find VARIOUS BOTTLES OF SHAMPOO AND CONDITIONER and dump all of them but one atop of the TOWEL. You stash the leftover SWEET HONEY SHAMPOO AND CONDITIONER BOTTLE in IRENE'S PACK for later.
Happy noww?
I can't smell you anyways. It was a joke.

You turn on the SHOWER to the highest setting and watch as the WATER starts to fizz up. You hope this ESTABLISHMENT has WATERPROOF APPLICANCES, otherwise things could get messy. You stand on the rim of the TUB WALL and notice a VENT on the CEILING.
Irene, p-prop me up!
You're making a mess.
It's either thiss or you kill people, so prop me up!
I'll entertain you.

You suddenly are raised to the CEILING, where IRENE quickly rips open the VENT COVER. Yeesh, the property damage. Regardless, you crawl into the VENTS, hacking up a storm. The VENTILATION was certainly unclean! IRENE quickly takes out an APPENDAGE in front of YOUR MOUTH.
Open wide.
Wha- *hack ack* n-

IRENE jams the APPENDAGE into your MOUTH and you can feel it open up inside, blasting air. It's an uncomfortable feeling, nonetheless, reminding you of STUPID VACUUM-RELATED DARES with LOS some time back. You continue to crawl forward until you find another VENT COVER below, where you can see and hear DRUNKARDS starting to freak out. Were BUBBLES that fast?
OKAY, WHO THA' FACK LEFT THE TUB ON?
Wussn't me, mate, quit looking at me.
I'M NOT CUSIN' YOU? GET OFF ME ASS!
You cannot see, but you can hear a punch being thrown, followed by more, and suddenly you realize you've started a BRAWL.
Look what nonviolence brought you. Violence.
MMMMMMMMM!
You furrow your brow and peer further down into the COVER.
Emmett, don't!
TURN-TURN OFF THE FACKIN' TUB!

The COVER breaks from the additional weight you put on it and you fall, hitting the FLOOR below. Given that IRENE'S APPENDAGE was in your MOUTH, she was unable to scoop you up. Confused, some of the DRUNKARDS stop fighting and walk up to you, peering from above.
F-Fuck me...
WHO'S THIS BUGGAH?
Tone down y'voice Jess, you're givin' me a eadache'!
FACK OFF, IT'S ME PARTY, I CAN BE AS LOUD AS I WANTEH.
This the guy who killed the party?
Tub's off!

No one seemed aggressive just yet, but given that you're on the FLOOR, you are a bit nervous, given that you're sure they have WEAPONS nearby. You're unsure how to handle this without IRENE having a TEMPER TANTRUM.
Act like you've been at the party the whole time. ⇒
Uh...
You nervously belch and smell the ALCOHOL, still fairly potent. The DRUNKARDS continue to stare at you, a bit disgusted, though some of them chuckle.
Don't remember im', but he's definitely off is' rocka'.
WHAT'S THIS WANKER DOING IN THA' CEILIN' THEN? MM?
Damnit, Jess, bloody let im' talk!
You feel YOUR HEAD, starting to get a bit of a headache from the fall.
Wanted to surprise you all with some drinks from above, but I think I m-may have drank em' all, h-heh.
You quickly grab an EMPTY BOTTLE on the FLOOR nearby and try to act like it was yours in the first place.
You're not part of the crew, are ye'? Did ol' pink hair send ye'?
TELL HIM WE'RE NOT COMIN' BACK WITHOUT SOME BLOODY GOOD DRINKS AND SOME PAYMENT. WE TOLL FOR THE GUY AND HE JUST SITS IN THE OFFICE ALL DAY.
I'm starting to grow weary of your voice, Jess. Settle down.
BITE ME.
I'm not part of the crew, but I'm quite *belch* drunk.
You hated forcing yourself to burp. It was disgusting, but it was necessary; not many people know a SQUOATLING'S ALCOHOL TOLERANCE, so not acting intoxicated could rise suspicion.
Well, you're alright to stay in our book, right Jess?
I WANT TO KNOW WHY THE WANKER BROKE IN TO OUR ESTABLISHMENT.
I have a, er, tendency to be stir violence. Thought sneaking in would be easier to splain'.
How could someone so cute cause people to be so angry?
That's what I-I'm sayin', heh.
WE'RE NOT JOINING CHOMSK.

He told me to tell you guys that he's been proposing a work plan that may appeal to you guys. Something about new missions and some of his special drinks. He's ashamed he couldn't give his team members attention during the peak of his battle with the Ravens.
Seems reasonable. Can't xactly' physically fight them given that they're powerhouses, and shouldn't give the location away.
Quite a thorn in the side.
WE SPENT THE TIME TO MAKE THIS COMPOUND, WE'RE STAYING HERE.
He said that's all right, as long as you continue following orders and attending meetings.
You manage to stand up and IRENE quickly pushes YOUR BACK from the PACK, creating an audible "crack" noise. Needless to say, it felt good.
THINK I'M NEEDING SOMETHING MORE.

You quickly search your PACK until realizing you have SOME GRAVBOOTS from the LAB you ransacked earlier. Damn, you really need to organize. These could have certainly helped you earlier. With IRENE, a lot of your issues regarding the CEILING tend to be solved, so you're not against giving them away.
Also, Chomsky bought you something you may enjoy, Jess, if I may.
You tossed the GRAVBOOTS to JESS, whose demeanor changed immediately upon receiving the EXPENSIVE-LOOKING GIFT.
HOLY SHIT, WHAT ARE THESE?
Chomsky told me how you've always bounced off the walls with your.... er, explosive personality.
Of course, you were lying. That is no one's business, however. The sooner you leave here, the sooner CHOMSKY can pave you a path to another of your kind.
For being drunk, you speak quite clearly.
Yeah, um...
But reek of some potent vodka, what's the gib?
Gib?
Deal. Sorry, I'm British. Have to say weird words sometimes for Big Ben.
The MAN puts up his PINKY FINGER and looks up at the CEILING.
British?
Religion.
A-Anyways, my species has a high tolerance to alcohol. Think we can have a BAC of something like... .155 when the GU standard is something like... .087.
HOW DO THESE WORK?
JESS has the GRAVBOOTS on, and he realizes there's a CYAN BUTTON on their sides. The moment he presses the BUTTONS simultaneously, he suddenly floats and adheres to the CEILING through the BOOTS.
FUCK, THAT WAS SCARY.
Have fun.
Wait a bit, you're that squoatling, aren't you? Thought you were killed by the LR?
Something like that.
Yeah, Chomsky told us stories about you. Was quite upset when you were announced dead.
Huh. Always thought he didn't really care about us.
Mostly you, and some spectre. Said you missed out on the deal of a lifetime not going with him. I mean, look how powerful we are!
They look fairly weak in this SMALL STRONGHOLD, but you are not going to break the ICE on that TOPIC.
Yeah, well, I don't think you guys are exactly looking for a squoatling, are you?
Guess that's fair, mate.
I think I'm gonna' head out. I can tell Chomsky of your loyalty?
YEAH, YEAH, WE'LL PLEASE THE BLOODY PISS OUTTA' IM'.
Jess, get down from the roof!
As they started to argue, you left the ESTABLISHMENT through the FRONT DOOR and headed off to CHOMSKY'S BASE OF OPERATIONS. You notice that IRENE'S been fairly quiet.
Still there?
Your pacifism was so lame that it made me want to do a system update over listening to you drone on.
Gee, thanks for protecting me back there. Really needed you.
Don't push it.
What were you updating anyhow?
Oh, you know, basic things, like firmware, targeting calibration, manipulation tech...
You did not respond, knowing she was trying to bait you.
What, no takers?
You are awful.
Got to keep me though! Don't you just love me?

Upon reaching the BASE, you notice CHOMSKY, WES, and all of the MEMBERS OF HIS GANG looking up at the SKY, holding various WEAPONS. You look as well, seeing a LLAMANIAN CORVETTE slow down to land. While you are terrified, you can almost make out the SERIAL CODE on the side from this distance, surprisingly. IRENE immediately produces a massive LASER CANNON and prepares an assault.
WAIT! STOP!
Aren't these the guys after you?
I WILL NOT LET THEM TAKE YOU!
You just need a little more time to decipher whether to stay and fight or to run, but you do not know how to get the OTHERS to hold their fire. Hopefully no one is trigger happy...
You start to cough viciously, not knowing what else to do.
What's wrong, Emmett?

You fall to the ground, making WES, CHOMSKY, and some of the MAFIA MEMBERS to rush over to you. You continue to fake it, purposely inhaling some of the DUST in the AIR to make your COUGHING FIT seem real.
Emmett, what's going on?
Do something, Chomsky!
IRENE put the LASER CANNON away and put an INHALATOR to your SNOUT, just as not too long ago when you were climbing through DUSTY VENTILATION.
Breathe. I don't know what's wrong with you, but you're scaring me.
You inhale deeply and stop coughing. You managed to give yourself a HEADACHE, and a bit of a RASPY VOICE for the time being. You notice the SHIP touching down, and can make out the SERIAL NUMBER...
O-223... That's him. Hold your fire...
IRENE pulls you up with her APPENDAGES and pats you on the BACK from the HOLOPACK. You continue to play WEAK for the time being, trudging over to the SHIP that just landed.
Hey, hey, hey, bud. We don't know who this guy is. Don't want you to get yourself hurt.
Who is this guy anyways?
We just said we don't know who it is, dummy.
That's a llamanian ship. My brother's ship...
You have a brother?

You push past CHOMSKY, who walked in front of you out of concern. The SHIP produces cool mist as the HATCH opens, revealing a CLEAN-SHAVEN, FORMALLY-DRESSED LLAMANIAN. He has some sort of WEAPON in HIS HAND that you cannot make out, but that does not matter to you. You recognize that this is LOS YELSI, a LLAMANIAN whom you have been very close to before you left the LLAMANIAN MOTHERSHIP. You take off the INHALATOR and drop the act, walking over to him.
LOS!
Hey. It's been a good while.
The two of you embrace, which starts a murmur amongst the MAFIA MEMBERS and WES.
I didn't know you're friends with the Llamanians, Emmett. Let alone into one.
You ignore the SNIDE COMMENTS and look up at LOS and smile.
How's it been, man?
I think I should be asking you that, dude. Been on quite the adventure, haven't we?
You've been tracking me?
You let go and look at him in worry.
They, uh... They assigned me to this position, Emmett.
We made a promise!
LOS lowers his brow, staring daggers into CHOMSKY. It seems he's worried about your safety.
I held up my promise. But you know I'm loyal to the Republic.
Over your own brother?
Emmett, can we talk about this on the ship? These guys are hardened criminals in the GU. I can't imagine they like any form of authority.
You look back at THE OTHERS and realize most of them have been pointing their WEAPONS at LOS. You move in front of him, worried.
Calm down, everyone. He's not here to hurt you.
How did he know our location?
Followed the gruesome breadcrumbs our buddy here left me.
I'm sorry? You led him here?
Not intentionally!
Emmett, this is going to put a dent in our plans. How can I know to trust you if you brought this guy here? Did you even do what I asked?
I did!
What is he talking about?
