CHOMSKY looks to HIS MEN and they all raise their WEAPONS at the only semblance of external authority. You start to sweat.
Emmett, we need to leave. These guys can't be trusted.
He puts AN ARM around you and makes his way to THE SHIP.
I wouldn't do that if I were you, Llamanian. Emmett and I have a deal, and if either the GU or the LR gets word of it, I will find you.
I thought you were a good guy, Chomsky!

Just because I have righteous intentions for the galaxy, that doesn't mean I can't be underhanded about how I get things done. If this guy takes you back to the mothership, you won't get another chance of finding your squoatling.
LOS stops, shivering a bit.
I just want my friend back, guys. No harm. I won't talk of this or where I found him.
How do I know you're not going to hurt him, huh?
Please don't shoot him, Chomsky.
IRENE takes out her WEAPONS, only escalating the situation.
WHAT IS THAT?!
IRENE, STOP!
Put your guns down, Emmett. Come on. Be reasonable.
You be reasonable! I lived with Los for over a GUY. I know he's trustworthy!
You swallow, not knowing what to do here. You can't let LOS be shot, nor can you leave the PLANET. There needs to be some way you can deescalate the situation and explain yourself to the TWO OF THEM.
Be a baby and scream. ⇒
LOS trembled minutely; you can feel that he is trying to look strong in this SITUATION, however the shaking is tearing at YOUR HEARTSTRINGS.
Get out of the way. I'm not gonna' be known as the guy who killed off the squoatlings.
If he doesn't put his guns down, I'm going to blast the mafia into smithereens.
Just a few more steps, Emmett. I can call this in and we'll keep you safe.
The influx of demands and threats entering YOUR EARS is starting to drive you crazy in the midst of THIS STRESS. You look CHOMSKY dead in THE EYES and puff out YOUR CHEST.
YOU SERIOUSLY THINK YOU CAN GET AWAY WITH THIS?
What are you talking about?
YOU THREATEN ME AND MY FAMILY FOR WHAT, SOME DRUNKARDS' LOYALTY?
I'm not threatening-
YOU'RE POINTING A GUN AT ME.
You're pointing cannons at me! Listen to yourself! You're going to strain your voice!
You release yourself from LOS's grasp and stomp over to CHOMSKY, diverting EVERYONE's attention to you, GUNS included.
What are you doing?
You breathe heavily and ball up YOUR HOOVES, er, the OPPOSABLE DIGITS ON YOUR HOOVES.
Emmett, you're scaring me bud. I will shoot you.
You let out a loud BLEAT, which catches EVERYONE, including IRENE, by surprise.
Really?
LOS and CHOMSKY seem to burst out in laughter as you hold YOUR MUZZLE in embarrassment. The GUNS are put down, and IRENE follows suit, leaving you to wallow in YOUR SHAME.
Intimidating!
Dude. I'll keep the peace if you never do that again.
Let's shake on it.
Keep your distance. Just believe me.
LOS stands there, a bit offended.
Fine.
You exhale sharply, mustering the courage to speak once again.
Let me talk to him for a bit and I'll get him out of your hair.
CHOMSKY snickers at YOUR VOICE CRACK and motions for you to tend to LOS.
If I get back and he's still here, deal's off.
CHOMSKY returns to THE STRONGHOLD along with the others, minus WES. He heads over to the two of you, looking fairly UNCOMFORTABLE.
You know, this place is crawling with deviants.
Pottle talking to the ket.
What?
Saying Seth used to say. Saying what you said was hypocritical.
"Pot talking to the kettle"?
You tongue-tied, you little baby?
I just saved your life at my expense, damnit. Give me a break.
Fine, fine.
It's great to see you again, though, even under these circumstances.
In YOUR PERIPHERAL VISION, you notice WES making smooching motions with HIS HANDS. You eyeball him angrily.
You know why I'm here. This is going to end with you coming home with me, man.
I'm sorry? Who helped me escape again?
It wasn't my plan to eventually have to capture you. I'm being forced here.
You sigh.
Think about it. They told the llamanian I was the closest to to clean up after me and whisk me away to prison.
Well yeah. "They" were afraid you were going to kill more people if anyone else came.
Los, I have not willingly killed a llamanian on my own accord since I left. Squoat's honor.
I mean, you are driving a prison tanker, Emmett. I don't think "they" willingly gave it up.
I never wanted to kill anyone, dude. Self defense.
What's with the lens?
This is what's gotten me into trouble, man.
LOS stares into your LEFT EYE, noticing the bright neon green color and faint CROSSHAIR surrounding YOUR PUPIL.
Never seen something like that. Are you okay?
Something called a SIP... Symbiotic Intelligence... Something.
Symbiotic Intelligence PARTNER. As in, ditch this guy. Slot's taken.
She makes me feel sick to my stomach and she wants to kill everything.
"She"?
Irene's its name, and it embedded itself in my nervous system through my eye.
Emmett, this isn't good. We can get professional help, man. You sound in pain over it.
I'm... I'm fine man. I'm not leaving this planet until I get what I need though.
Some sort of deal with the hardass?
Emmett, if we want to get that information, we're gonna' need to get through this quickly.
How do you know about it?
About what?
News travels, my guy.
You fold YOUR ARMS and look at the GROUND.
Chomsky's promised me information from a GU core planet in exchange for some work I did for him.
You know we have much more information than they do at this point, right?
Maybe so, but they have intel on a potential living squoatling.
Really?
Yeah, man. And I'm not returning home until I get insight on the matter. This is my calling, and I need to know if they're real.
I... I think I need to make a call.
Don't be long. I want to tell you goodbye.
As LOS leaves, you turn to WES, who was making EUPHEMISTIC MOTIONS with his HANDS.
Dude.
What? You guys lived together for like, two GUYs, yeah?
What's it to you?
I saw you admiring him, dude. Never took you for a fan of the man.
I am literally trying to find a female squoatling, Wes.
What do you call what I just saw then?
Wes, if I tell you, will you shut the fuck up?
Damn, no need to be so rude.
Sorry.
Tell me the deets.
You sit in a GRASSY PATCH and look up at the CLOUDS.

He was like a light in the darkness for me. Just chose to leave my family for a glimpse of hope only to be thrown into a glass cage. People stared at me like an exhibit... And Los and his cronies didn't. They respected me, took care of me... He's a true friend.
Lame.
I'm a fan of him. Only him though.
You wink at WES, who was thoroughly confused. You wait patiently for LOS and lie back…
Have hot sex with Los in front of Wes ⇒
You keep on staring at the SKY and remember your HISTORY with LOS. You have had some GOOD TIMES on the LLAMANIAN MOTHERSHIP, some a bit particularly INTIMATE for just being FRIENDS.
Wait, so you like Los?
I made a promise to him that I would return to the mothership if there wasn't another squoatling in the galaxy. And you know, I don't think I would mind living with him for a good while.
Your BRAIN ends up with LEWD THOUGHTS and you get a tad embarrassed, looking down at a TENT GETTING PITCHED.
Emmett, can you not get aroused right now?
Not my fault Wes decided to put these thoughts in my head.
What? I didn't do shit!

You consider the THOUGHT of getting DOWN AND DIRTY with LOS when he gets back, but then realize you probably would not have enough time to finish before CHOMSKY gets back. And then you would be in a WORLD OF TROUBLE. Regardless of the SITUATION, it has been a while since you have wet your whittle willingly, nigh MASTURBATORY ROBOTS aside.
You pass off the IDEA and continue to watch the WHITE CLOUDS drift by. Eventually, WES breaks the silence, having felt a tad uncomfortable from YOUR CONFESSION.
Well, your knight in shining armor's coming out, loverboy.
You roll YOUR EYES at WES's sarcasm and prop yourself up on YOUR ELBOWS, seeing LOS exit HIS SHIP.
Just called the Republic.
Are you crazy?! Chomsky's going to kill us!
Quiet, you. I didn't tell them of our location. They could care less about some pink-haired idiot and his gang right now.
What did you tell them?
For one, I told them I found you. And that you don't want to go back.
Let me guess, they suggested to take me forcefully for a nice reprimanding?
I'm sure they were going to say something along those lines, but I beat them to the chase and mentioned your goal here.
You get up from the GROUND the moment he gets near and dust yourself off.
The whole blackmailing the GU Core World thing?
First of all, they're happy that you were the one to find out about this before them.
Sure they were.
Whatever. The more important part is that they want you to continue on this mission.
Really now?
You fold YOUR ARMS confidently, knowing there is a catch to the LLAMANIAN REPUBLIC'S change of plans.
What, the moment I find the squoatling I have to surrender myself up?

They didn't say. I told them about your eye as well, and they consider that too much of a liability right now to take you in. Apparently the SIPs were pretty damn terrifying back in their hay day. At least the reprogrammed ones.
I mean, you guys need more firepower, right?
... That's exactly what I'm getting to. After your joyride in the GU, they, at the very least, want to extract that thing-
Irene.
Shut up.
That's a bit rude.
Talking to Irene. The SIP in question.
Mmh. They want to extract Irene from you so that they can modify the SIP technology to the LR's advantage.
What about me?
Again, no idea.
This is great and all, but what are you going to do?
Seeing as it's my job to capture fuzzycheeks over here, I've been redelegated to keeping him safe, from a distance, of course.
Pffft. Fuzzycheeks?
The gang back on the ship called him that as Vescha found him rubbing his face on a pillow in his sleep during a... uh... sleepover. Concise way to explain it.
More sex stuff?
I'm sorry?

No and screw you. I slept between houses to escape the Llamanian Squoatling Preservation Division's authority. Vescha took pictures of me and sent them to everyone because she thought it was hilarious.
Fuzzycheeks.
Hey Irene?
WES backed off.
Chomsky's going to be here any minute, fuzzycheeks.
I also told them of you, Wes. Being a prison escapee and all.
Ooof. Right. You're gonna' have to take me in?
No, actually, They want to pardon you and give you a job.
No way!
Help us out with this plan and you'll be recruited as a spy for the Llamanian Republic.
Uh... a spy?
I mean, you're a charismatic rogue who's fallen from grace. Kind of a great deal.
Gee. Thanks.
Wrap it up. You've been talking with Los for what feels to be a month. ⇒
Yeesh. Has it been that long?
You look over at the STRONGHOLD and notice CHOMSKY'S ORANGE SHADES appearing from the entrance, reflecting SUNLIGHT.
Los, I think it's time to go, man.
Just kiss already.
Chomsky's about to come in here, and I need this.
I getcha'. I'll be watching you. Always got your back.
He hits YOUR SHOULDER playfully and rustles YOUR TUFT.
What about me?
It's up to Emmett who you're going with. I need to jet. If he wants you to go with me, just give me a call.
He gives you a COMMUNICATOR and starts heading back to HIS SHIP. You shield YOUR FACE as the SHIP lifts off the GROUND and heads into SPACE.
Why do you get power over me?
I did save you.
Indirectly!
Eh. I mean, I did kill some guards.
You didn't even want to!
Pink monkey warning.
CHOMSKY walks up to you and watches LOS'S SHIP leaving the atmosphere.
God, I hate llamanians. Always trying to think they're better than everyone else.
Chomsky. He was literally non-threatening. You nearly killed him over him existing.
Thought you would hate them, given that they killed your race and all.
Let's drop this subject. What's the plan, man?
I contacted my friend on the inside. Wants to conduct a meeting with you to make sure you're who you say you are. This is pretty serious business. Multiple felony charges if either of you get caught.
How are they going to arrest someone who's legally dead?
That is stupid. Do you hear yourself?
He has a point, Chomsky.
The GU is the leading force of redtape in the galaxy. There's bound to be some loophole or data they can change.
You start to stamp YOUR BACKHOOF in the GROUND idly. You want action. This PLANET sucks.
Let's be real. This guy seems sketchy.
What? Really?
I didn't say anything.
Is this guy trustworthy?
Hadn't had any problems with him so far.
Need to stay cautious.
Where's this guy anyhow?
Close to the core. I'll send you the coordinates.
I'll stay armed.
Er, no. Don't do that.
You need the coordinates to get there.
Chomsky, are you dense? I told you about Irene already. My SIP?
Idiot.
Oh. I forgot.
Anyhow, thanks for your help man. Sorry for the inconvenience.
All good. Don't come back though. If you want to talk, you got me on comms.
I was literally just given this communicator.
CHOMSKY messes with HIS COMMUNICATOR and pings yours.
Huh.
Sayonara, squoatling. Don't die. For real, that is.
Yeah. Take care of yourself, Chomsky.

You look off to YOUR SHIP and eyeball WES. Should he join you to THE CORE? He's a bit goofy and absentminded, but he's been with you so far. Maybe he would be more useful with LOS. Anyhow, you're unsure if you want to do anything else here, though you could pester CHOMSKY for ARMAMENTS. So, what now? WES or NO WES? Leave or stay?
Head off and let Wes tag along. ⇒
Alright, Wes, let's go.
I knew you would keep me onboard.
To be fair, I gotta' take you regardless. Los already left.
Oh.
For the time being, we're going to head off to the coordinates.
Right on cue, your new COMMUNICATOR pings. An ADDRESS sends you the following COORDINATES:
He wasn't kidding. That's really close to the core.
Dangerous.
You and WES head off to the LLAMANIAN BRIG SHIP that you arrived here in.
Hey, can I see?
Sure.
You show WES the COORDINATES. He stares at them for a bit before looking confused.
What the hell do these mean?
You giggle as the two of you enter the SHIP.

So, essentially, the first three numbers stand for a position. The sector is about a five thousand unit cube, in this case, sector A, which is near the origin. The W stands for what octant the sector is in. The octants are N, W, S, E, alpha, beta, gamma, and omega.
Uh... yeah. What's an octant?
It's like a container of the sectors. There's eight of them. The exact origin is the center of the galaxy, or a blackhole named SAG-A.
How did you learn all of this stuff?
You take a seat at the COCKPIT and input the COORDINATES into the CONSOLE.
You know, no one's ever been that interested in space navigation, at least from what I've seen. It's already so automated and whatnot.
It just looks confusing, man. Getting an AI to do everything is just easier.
Guess that's the benefit of living on a old ship most of your life. Get to learn the ins and outs.
WES stares at you with a surprisingly solemn look as you start the SHIP up. The ENGINE purrs and you start to lift off.
You've had to deal with this your whole life, haven't you?
What do you mean?
Living like a scoundrel. Not having a formal family to take care of you.
I wouldn't say that. The VP were my family.
That's different. I mean like a real family, in a real homestead. Growing up without the risk of dying.
You sigh, closing YOUR EYES.
I guess not. It just kind of wears off, I guess. I prefer to stay in the present. Let bygones be bygones, you know?
As a celebrity, I didn't have to deal with that. Always had adoring fans and friends to look forward to. Security to protect me.
Yeah.
Since those scandals after you all kidnapped me, life hasn't really been the same. I can't believe you've lived like that for decades.
The SHIP enters HYPERSPACE. You raise an EYEBROW and open YOUR EYES, giving WES a stern look.
Wes, if you think you're suffering as much as I have, you need a reality check.
I'm sorry?
I have been the last known squoatling ever since the Purgation of Vortox. For much of my childhood aboard Seth's ships, I was under constant threat and scrutiny.
I get that-

No, you don't. You didn't have to deal with a bully who threatened to get you killed every other week. You didn't have to deal with a bunch of assholes who were trying to prey on you. You didn't have your heart break on multiple occasions because of your gullible, friendly, disposition.
I-uh... Big words...
What?
That last part. That sounded really personal.
It all is.
I checked Llamanian records and noticed a certain Fione, reported to have had sexual relations with you.
Irene. Shut up.
Your adoptive father apparently airlocked her, from what I'm assuming. Was found decompressed. Punctured lungs and internal bleeding.
Irene.
I make note of this in terms of your hypocrisy. You call them assholes but still manage to get them in your pants.
SHUT UP, DAMNIT.
You slam a fist on the CONSOLE and immediately feel pain. You hold YOUR HOOF and let out a small bleat of defeat.
I'm sorry.
It's fine. Don't weep about what you've lost, man. It'll get better. It always does.
You sure have a lot of pent up feelings.
Irene, please leave me alone.
Should I prescribe immediate stress relief?
NO.
The two of you remain quiet for a bit as the SHIP continues to its destination. You eventually realize how awkward the ATMOSPHERE is, so you cough loudly.
So, uh... About this guy.
What about him?
That's the thing. Know nothing about him. Sure he's safe?
In my experience, most people I don't trust are... hazy.
What do you mean?
What he means is that most of his memories of shady criminals he's had deals with are typically removed by use of a flasher. Presumably by Seth.
I just accept that you just own me at this point.
We're PARTNERS. Emphasis on the PARTNER part. We need to know everything about each other.
I know nothing about you, aside from you being a murderous asshole.
That's besides the point.
Toxic.
I know, right?
A HAND extends out from the HOLOPACK and slaps WES square in the face. He reactively holds HIS CHEEK, offended.
What the hell?!
You are lucky that my PARTNER prohibits me from doing anything further.
You mutter to yourself, "As if I have that power.", which IRENE promptly ignores. The NAVIGATION CONSOLE starts to beep loudly, alerting that the DESTINATION is near.
I think you should be more prepared for this interaction in case things go haywire, Emmett.
Yeah, well... I think you...
Nice.
Shut up, I'm thinking.
As the SHIP lands, you start to worry a bit about THIS GUY. He's offering you INFORMATION on another SQUOATLING, but it seems... too good to be true. What should you do?
Coordinate with Wes. Be prepared for what awaits. ⇒
If I know anything, it's that I've dealt with situations like these in the past.
Yeah? What do we do then?
Uh...

Have you really dealt with these types of situations in the PAST? Most of the times you were set out for negotiation, and SETH was back up in case things got hairy. But SETH's not here and WES is a PUSHOVER, which, in retrospect, that's crazy that you think this considering that you're a PUSHOVER yourself. IRENE will just kill them. Maybe that's not too terrible; it is you against the GALACTIC UNION at this point... Actually...
Irene, you're my "partner", right?
Oh, so now you need me?
I'm going to start treating you like one. I'm relying on you to go ham if you ever feel my life's in danger.
You really mean that?
Emmett, I don't think...
Yes. As much as I hate it, I need manpower here in case things go south. And frankly, Wes, you're not enough.
HEY!
I've had to save you on two separate occasions from getting your ass kicked.
Yeah? So? You're just going to let murdertron get you into even deeper shit if you get caught?!
You remain quiet for a second, and get up, ready to exit the SHIP.
A dead man walking has no consequences to worry about.
Edgy.
That's how you want me to think, right?
Not exactly, but I welcome the steps you're taking for me.
I can't believe what I'm hearing!
But there's a limit, Irene. If a person ever has information that pertains to the potential continuation of my species, you let me deal with them.
As long as you can pose a threat.
Emmett, you just entered the Singularity of Pelforas.
I don't know your reference.

It's like the oldest kid's story in the galaxy. Pelforas found a point in space where the mass was ridiculously dense. He wanted to study it, so he got close to it for research. Once he went in, he couldn't get out, and he was spread across all time and space, permanently suffering in agony.
Huh.
Hell awaits the galaxy with that psychotic AI.
What, like Earth's weird Pandora's Box story?
No idea.
SETH sure had some weird STORIES with MORALS he never followed.

You make your way out of the SHIP, making sure IRENE was ready. The PLANET you landed upon was rocky and barren, being rather desolate. You figured THE GUY wanted to meet here to maintain secrecy. You are really close to the center of the GU, anyhow. You see an AMPHIBIOUS BEING standing by a POOL of some liquid you can't make out. He was adorned in COMFORTABLE-LOOKING PURPLE ROBES, smoking out of an ANCIENT PIPE of sorts. The moment he notices you, he smirks.
Took you a while to get to me, Tawfeek.
His VOICE sounds like he is gurgling with each breath, disgusting you.
Who are you?
Call me Felps. You're going to be seeing me quite frequently from now on.
You hear IRENE already starting to take out her CANNONS from the PACK. FELPS is unfazed.
Big weapons, huh?
He takes out a DISC, flashing it right in front of HIS CHEST.
Put them away, boy.
Irene, a moment.
Don't like this.
IRENE puts away the CANNONS.
What do you want with me?
You see, Emmett, I have a few things I need done for me. Some... missions, perhaps?
Go on.

The Vortox Pummelers were one of the most infamous bounty hunting groups in the galaxy, showing off their spontaneous, odd personalities in making a reputation for themselves. Regularly partook in assassinations of the most prolific figures in the Galactic Union, stole a chunk from the Llamanian Mothership estimated to be about 2.5 kilometers in diameter. And their prized possession, you.
I know this.
I know you do! Hence how I know you're not afraid to get your hooves dirty.
What's stopping me from killing you and taking the disc?
Encrypted data. Also, there's an explosive that's wired to my lifeline. I know how desperate you are.
I'm not going to slave for some potentially useful information.
Have another lead?
You groan, sighing as you knew he was right.
Oh, come on. Don't be like that. It will be easy. I just can't be attached to it.
What, use me as some kind of scapegoat?
Well, no. You won't be a scapegoat. You'll actually be the one to blame, as you'll be doing the crime.
Oh. Yeah.
It seems you feel like you are getting dumber by the moment talking to FELPS.
What do you want anyhow?

The first mission will be simple. It appears that one of my political rivals has some dirt on me that he's bound to expose at the next GU summit in a semester. He regularly shows off that he has this information, having stupidly locked it in a glass case in his office.
Pride tends to make people ignorant, I suppose.

You'll be sneaking into the office to steal it. If you trip any alarms, I'll leave up to you what happens. If anyone's in a suit, has a crown, or looks moderately important, do not kill them. That will come later.
Convenient.
I know! Isn't blackmail fun?
This isn't blackmail, this is an unfair trade. I'm risking my life to be a pawn for you.
Do you not accept? I can always just... I don't know, tell the GU where you are. Or the Llamanian Republic. Maybe they'd consider some sort of ceasefire for a bit with a hostage on the line.
Now that's blackmail.
Don't think of yourself as a pawn. Think of you being a knight. You can easily get in the backend of my enemy and dance about them.
And are fairly expendable.
Exactly. Now you're getting it. Now go. I'll send you the coordinates of my district through your communicator.
How does everyone know how to contact me?
You have your visibility set to public, Emmett.
You smack YOUR FACE with the palm of your HOOF, changing the SETTINGS on your COMMUNICATOR.
You shouldn't have let him use you. I know you aren't good at intimidating.
What, should I have threatened to kill him and risk he destroy the disc?

You could have used his political reputation against him. He is ordering you to grab some information that would have been used against him anyhow. If you threatened to expose him, he could have given us what we wanted.
You look back and notice he's left the POOL, having completely disappeared. For him to have moved so fast, you presume he was actually a HOLOGRAM, being projected from a nearby SHIP.
Was he a hologram?
I wasn't able to detect any ships nearby.
Jammer?
If so, you really need to pay more attention. Holograms are fairly easy to see flaws in.
Noted. Let's just get this over with.
He's going to keep on using you.
We'll find a way out.
You make your way back to your SHIP to see WES standing at the entrance.
How did it go?
Threatened to expose our whereabouts to the GU or the LR in exchange for doing some illegal activities for him. Some bigshot political figure.
Sucks.
Fairly underwhelming too.
You get a ping in your COMMUNICATOR displaying the COORDINATES of the GU POLITICAL CENTRE in question. What now?
Contact Felps's political rival. ⇒
Maybe if we head to the political center we can contact the guy. Flip this over on its head.
Yeah, that could work.
We'd need to keep video coms scrambled. Also, location services off on your communicator, Emmett.
You groan and mess with the COMMUNICATOR for a few minutes trying to find the OPTION.
I hate social devices.
What's wrong with you? I thought you were good with technology.
I messed with communicators like once or twice as an engineer for the VP. Translators I feel like I'm an expert on.

You groan, remembering how SETH stuck HIS HEAD in HIS WIFE'S ANUS to find an UNBROKEN TRANSLATOR. You hand the COMMUNICATOR over to WES and enter the SHIP, setting the COORDINATES to the POLITICAL CENTRE.

After some time in HYPERSPEED, you make it to the OUTERMOST RINGS of the GU CORE WORLDS. You start to sweat, realizing how easily the METAPHORICAL TARGET ON YOUR BACK could be spotted and taken advantage of.
Irene, when we land, help me find any source of data for contacting Felps's rival.
WES sets a BLASTER on the TABLE audibly, catching your attention.
I'm going too.
Uh... I don't know if that's a good idea.
You said earlier that I'm a pushover. I need to show you that I'm more than that.
Wes, I didn't mean it in a mean way...
But you did mean it.
Fine. Tag along.
Wes is going to get you in trouble.
Honestly, since Emmett's effectively signed a pact with a ROBOT DEVIL, I don't think we have much to worry about. Who says we can't just take over the planet for ourselves?
You stare at WES, wide-eyed.
Wes, you do realize that Irene is not indestructible, right?
I-uh...
Robot devil.
IRENE scoffs.
I can help you take over the planet, sure, Wes. But the moment backup arrives with an EMP, you two are as good as dead.
We need to be sneaky.
Your colorful outfit isn't sneaky, Emmett.
Whatever. Let's get this over with.
You make it to a GU SECURITY BOOTH surrounding the PLANET. A ROBOTIC VOICE blares into your SHIP'S INTERCOM.
LLAMANIAN REPUBLIC PENAL SHIP H-347. IDENTIFY YOUR PURPOSE BEFORE WE SEND IN SECURITY.
Shit.
IRENE does some quick computing and responds in a gruff voice, similar to a few LLAMANIAN GENERALS you have encountered in the past.
GENERAL LLEMMOND. I am harboring GU prisoners of war and plan to negotiate their release with some of our own.
You swear that name is familiar.
ONE MOMENT... YOU MAY ENTER. LAND IN PARKING SPACE F MINOR.
The BOOTH scans your SHIP and opens a GATE. As you land, you remember who IRENE referenced.
Los was friends with Reverend Remmond. She was a diplomat on Moldarr. Took an interest in me back at the Mothership.
I used your memory to quickly make something up.
She always had the softest hands...
Now's not the time to get aroused.
WES looks at you in disgust. You glare back at him.
Give me a break. It's nearly mating season.

WES gags for a second before exiting the SHIP. You flip over YOUR HOOD and put up your BANDANA. Upon entering the MAIN BUILDING, you see a large CENTRAL CORRIDOR with thousands of WINDOWS and DOORS of varying sizes heading up into the SKY. There are DROIDS and DEVICES traveling from DOOR to DOOR, sending mail, news, and other matters of importance.
This may take a while.
You think?
Well, what do you do now?
Scan the area. Find the rival. ⇒
Irene, can you scan for the correct office?
Do you think I'm some sort of genie?
Just do something, damn.
IRENE gives a highly autotuned sigh and props YOUR ARM up with an ARM from the HOLOPACK.
What are you doing?
One of the DROIDS notices YOUR HOOF raised and races over to you. You sweat, hoping IRENE didn't just screw the pooch on the mission.
HOW MAY I BE OF ASSISTANCE...
The DROID'S protruding SCREEN changes to a STATIC-FILLED LOADING SYMBOL. After about a minute, WES starts to get impatient.
This bot's brok-
ERROR. USER NAME UNKNOWN. USER GUID UNKNOWN. USER RACE UNKNOWN. PLEASE REVEAL YOUR FACE.
You tighten the BANDANA around YOUR FACE and glare at WES.
Show your face.
What? You raised your hand.
He doesn't have hands, idiot.
Well la-dee-dah. Hoof. Who cares?
You certainly gained a backbone.
I just want to get out of here. We could easily be caught.
PLEASE REVEAL YOUR FACE.
You'll go to prison, sure. On the other hand, I have a very, very large execution bounty on my head.
I'm too famous to go to prison!
Show. Your. Face. Now.
WES reluctantly complies, standing in front of you.
ANOLE. STATE YOUR NAME AND ROLE.
... Tartar Resnov, a representative of the... uh... Association for Retired Hoverracers... I am here to see...
Felic Yungistroph.
You smack your FACE in frustration. For someone afraid of revealing himself, WES sure is being on the nose.
Felic Yungistroph. I have a proposition to share with him.
PLEASE WAIT WHILE I CHECK IF MR. YUNGISTROPH IS CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE.
You wait another long minute. IRENE naturally had complaints to share.
Way to go, Tartar. Totally didn't raise any suspicion mentioning the ARH, where you're a head member already.
Stop talking!
HE IS ON LUNCH BREAK. WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEND HIM A MEMO?
Send us to his office.
HE IS ON LUNCH BREAK. WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEND HIM A MEMO?
I have explicit permission from Felic himself to have me in his office at this time.
SUBJECT OVERRIDE. EXECUTING OPERATION.
The DROID'S TORSO opens up, extending out a LONG, FOLDED STRIP OF METAL. The METAL then unfolds to create a PLATFORM.
STAND ATOP OF THE BED. PLEASE KEEP YOUR LIMBS WITHIN THE CONFINES OF THE BED AS I TAKE YOU TO OFFICE #59B-20A.

Without a second thought, you get onto the BED. WES is hesitant, but he follows soon after. The DROID lifts upwards, and travels at a moderate pace to the OFFICE. IRENE roots you to the BED with two of the HOLOPACK ARMS while keeping WES from falling with the other two.
Eventually, the DROID stops at a BALCONY. There was little space on the BALCONY, leading to a rather GRANDIOSE DOOR.
OFFICE #59B-20A. PLEASE EXIT THE BED.
Thanks.
The TWO OF YOU exit the PLATFORM and open the DOOR. As the DROID drives off, you look down from the BALCONY.
Quite high...
Careful.
Get in here before you fall.

The OFFICE is a rather small single room. There is an EXECUTIVE DESK with an appropriate EXECUTIVE CHAIR on the other side. In front of it are two CUSHIONED SEATS. Behind the EXECUTIVE CHAIR is a FIREPLACE, which is burning a bright blue. On the sides of the room are a DOOR labeled, "FELIC'S POWDER ROOM", and a PAINTING with a SMALL DRAWER beneath it. It appears FELIC is not in here, though he probably left recently given how bright the FIRE is.
Cozy.
Only an insane person would call an office "cozy".
Well, you have some time to kill. What now?
Snoop around. ⇒
The flash drive is likely in the desk.
Maybe I should've asked the drone for the restroom...
There's-
Tartar over here can't read, Emmett. Be respectful.
Not letting go of that name, huh?
WES storms off into the POWDER ROOM, clearly upset.
We need to update you to be nicer.

IRENE electronically scoffs. Ignoring the remark, you head to the DESK and open the DRAWER after pushing aside the EXECUTIVE CHAIR. You find the BLACKMAIL FLASHDRIVE, SEVERAL (~) PENS OF ASSORTED COLORS, and an ENVELOPE WITH A FAMILIAR GREEN, BLACK, AND GOLD EMBLEM on it.
Got the flash. But this envelope...
Do you seriously not recognize the emblem?
Familiar, but I don't- wait, this is the flag proposed by the Llamanians for-
The Squoatlings prior to their attack.
Yeah. I got that.
You rip open the ENVELOPE and see a LIST OF COORDINATES, alongside SQUOATLING NAMES. Some are etched out in red. Others, appended with purple question marks.
I don't get it.
A list of last sightings for Squoatlings. Don't you see your name?
Sure as rain, your name was written down, with multiple etched out coordinates. "LLAMANIAN MOTHER SHIP" was circled, and a single line struck through your name.
Deceased.
Captain obvious.
Do you contribute anything useful?

You continue to scan the LIST, turning it around. Apparently a number of your kind survived the Purgation of Vortox, but most were captured and killed. Two names on the back are untouched, one with compounding coordinates like yours. The other entirely blank. Despite this information giving you hope, you still have a bleak mindset over these two, figuring they're likely old news.
This "Squorchy Vurkallus" seems to have gotten around.
No kidding.
Before you could make a note of the latest coordinates for SQUORCHY, you hear a yell from the POWDER ROOM.
HELP!
You immediately jump up and race to the POWDER ROOM, only to find a BLASTER pointed at your face.
Take off the pack.
Wh-Wes?
Now.
IRENE quickly takes out the PACK'S ARMS, but the man is quick to the draw.
SIP OVERRIDE -1, VOCAL CODE: BRAINI-WAY.
IRENE immediately shuts down, the ARMS from the PACK falling to the floor. The eyesight in your LEFT EYE dims, causing you to freak out.
OKAY! OKAY, IM TAKING OFF THE PACK.
You throw the PACK to the ground, seeing WES tied up in the SHOWER behind the INTRUDER.
Now, what are you, Tawfeek, doing in my office?
Comply. Look for an opening. ⇒
I'm assuming you already know why.
Quick, aren't you? I rigged the drone to let you guys in without question. It was textbook, really.
I think your rigging needs some work. Wes had to introduce himself to it.
I'll keep that in mind for next time.
FELIC YUNISTROPH cocks the BLASTER, striding about you.
Take a seat, squoatling.
You look about you and notice no SEATS. Well, aside from the TOILET.
Now.
You take a SEAT on the TOILET and scratch at YOUR EYE for a bit, still shaken from being partially blinded.
I hate you guys.
What, Wes and me?
Is that his name? Wes?
For the love of god, no one knows me anymore...
I mean you, the furry prick who ransacked my home, killed my family, and took most of what I owned from that mothership.
You furrow YOUR BROW in confusion.
I don't understand.
The heist you pulled off over two GUYs ago.
You're blaming me for a coordinated effort to take down the Llamanian Empire?
Should've killed you when I had the chance.
You look over at WES who was starting to struggle. Maybe if you distracted this PSYCHOPATH for a bit longer, WES could actually prove himself useful.
So I take it your personal vendetta against me is from somehow noticing me in that heist?
Let me jog your memory...

He dons a GOLDEN MASK that covers three-quarters of HIS UNCANNY-LOOKING FACE. That is, he looks to be a HUMAN with SCARS AND BURNS ON HIS FACE that were made more prevalent from a botched plastic surgery. It takes you a second, but you begin to recognize him.
OH! You're the fuck who singled me out and gave me this!
You move some FUR from YOUR RIGHT CHEEK on YOUR FACE and show a FADED SCAR. After doing this, he quickly whips you in the FACE with his BLASTER, causing you to wince and put a HOOF where he hit you.
What the fuck?
I'm the one in charge here. You're supposed to be dead.
W-What's with the hatred?
You guys were a blight on the galaxy. Never attempted to join the GU, always listening to your pretender king of a god above all else.
Did... did you participate in the Purgation?
And with good intentions too. You're unnatural. Unholy abominations that don't follow any evolutionary logic.

You don't really know how to feel. This GUY really hates YOUR GUTS for what appears to be little to no reason. You hear WES snap HIS RESTRAINTS, or at least attempt to. You stomp loudly, staging anger to try to keep this LUNATIC focused on you.
And how do you know this, exactly? "We" did you no fucking harm.

All documented species in the galaxy follow similar patterns, complex or not. Most lifeforms develop through hundreds of millions of years of evolution. Others are unique, having some logical, galactic significance for breaking the rules. Like the Matridi, Elven gods, and Stan Smith.
What-

LET ME FINISH. The logic behind their existence is fairly complicated and would probably bore you to death before I killed you. Squoatlings are different. They're tied to a passive, non-sentient creature that idly eats grass and rodents in a desert planet, however pathetic that sounds. That's your only evolutionary tie. Afterwards, over the course of what I presume is about 20 GUYs, you suddenly become a bipedal, highly-intelligent being capable of overzealous empathy, productivity, and laziness.
This awkward explanation is making you uneasy. How long has THIS GUY been studying YOUR SPECIES? Regardless, you do know something about what he's talking about.
One issue with what you're talking about. Uplifting exists.
He pushes the BLASTER to your HORNS, nudging you.

Uplifting requires a highly concentrated effort from a higher civilization, trillions of Ducketts, and hundreds of GUYs. Nor is it a perfected practice. The Vortox system was not discovered until 1215 GUY. No instances of a higher civilization nor assistance were observed.

Well, it certainly could have. However, after being tasked with exterminating you heathens, I found some interesting technology in the Squoatling anatomy. Technology that far exceeds anything documented within the Galactic Union.
He takes out a REMOTE and speaks into it.
AND WHILE IT'S RATHER COMPLICATED, I SPENT MY TIME REVERSE-ENGINEERING IT.
The RECEIVER in YOUR HEAD rings madly with HIS VOICE, reverberating YOUR BODY. You hold YOUR EARS to no avail.
Despite the fact that I hate you people, there's something wrong going on here. It's anomalous. And I expect to get extract great research out of your autopsy.
You keep quiet, noticing WES sneak up behind him.
Perhaps we can finally find out what created you, for the galaxy's benefit.
You look smugly at him, feeling rather comfortable.
Perhaps you need some bitches, considering you spent most of your life dead set on killing a peaceful agrarian people to fulfill some deranged conspiracy.
Alright, that's enough out of you.

You duck quickly before he pulls the TRIGGER. The BLASTER creates a SMALL DENT AND HOLE IN THE WALL. Before he could react, WES takes HIS ROPE and starts to strangle him. He starts to flail around, trying to shake WES off of him.
GET OFF... FOR... YOUR BENEFIT.
You don't deserve to know the truth.
Activate my SIP. Then we'll consider keeping you alive.
CAN'T... SPEAK.
Activate the fucking partner.
SIP REBOOT... VOCAL...
He starts choking violently and stops flailing around as much.
Let him breathe, Wes!
CODE BRAINI-WAY. USE YOUR BRAIN, EMMETT.

Your BRAIN is pounding. Whether from the stress of nearly dying, the threat of being killed, the knowledge that someone was feverishly into squoatling-murder, or IRENE booting back up, it was clouding most of your thoughts. The sight of FELIC getting strangled was frankly pitiful. However, he certainly deserved it. If not for his racist motivations, he gashed YOUR FACE years ago in defending the LLAMANIAN EMPIRE. That's reason enough.
Holy shit, dude...
WES releases the ROPE around FELIC'S NECK the moment he felt certain he was dead.
Are you okay?
I'm unsure.
Something tells me that guy who blackmailed us into stealing the flash drive actually just sent us into a trap.
I'm aware of that.
The moment you saw a gun pointed to your face that observation should've been fairly apparent.
Well, despite your snarkiness, Irene, Wes just saved our asses.
How would I have known this information?
You stand up from the TOILET and nudge FELIC'S BODY with your BACKHOOF.
He's dead.
Humans sicken me sometimes.
I believe he's a Vurgal, actually. A subspecies of human produced from illegal experimentation and uplifting practices on sentient beings.
How can you tell?

My database says something along the lines of incredible intellect, a prowess in scientific development, and a nearly white complexion. Also pertinent is the scarring on the face, which are actually protruding veins and nerves.
You take the GOLDEN MASK from FELIC'S BODY and notice just about everything IRENE said.
What a waste.
It had to be done. Also, you weren't that upset whenever we were killing Llamanians.
He had a clear neurological issue with him, dude. The Llamanians, even if they've turned a new leaf, are still mindlessly loyal to their missions assigned to them.
I don't think your boyfriend would appreciate you saying that.
I don't think he would really care, frankly.
Want me to call him to make sure?

You exit the RESTROOM and return to the OFFICE. As stated prior, there is an EXECUTIVE DESK with a FLASHDRIVE and FILES within it. Behind the DESK is a CHAIR, and in front are two CUSHIONED SEATS. There is a PAINTING with a SMALL DRAWER beneath it. There is also a FIREPLACE that burns a DIM BLUE. It appears the HOSTAGE SITUATION you were just in took some time.
What now?

You dig into the DESK and take out the FLASHDRIVE and the LIST OF SQUOATLINGS from before.
I guess Felps is a dirty liar.
It would appear that way, yes. Surprised it took you this long to reach that conclusion.
Irene, not everything I say aloud is a SUDDEN REALIZATION.
It sure takes you awhile to vocalize your thoughts.
Can you shut the fuck up? We just murdered a guy.
Technically it was self-defense.
Do you really think the GU is going to see it that way? We're fugitives.
I'm only a fugitive of Llamanian captivity, to be fair.
You stand there idly for a bit, taking in what just happened. WES starts to steal meaningless GU TRINKETS and some of FELIC'S LEGAL DOCUMENTS, for some odd reason.
You should check some of these out, they're pretty lame.

Because it's more fun than what you're doing currently.
After a while, an EARPIERCING ALARM starts to BLARE.
SECURITY BREACH IN OFFICE #59B-20A. CASUALTIES DETECTED. FUGITIVES WES ROMAW AND-ERROR NULL POINTER EXCEPTION. EXCEPTION HANDLED. PROCEED. PROCEED WITH CAUTION. HIGH ALERT.
It would appear your antics with me has gained you some infamy.
What's with this alarm blaring some error? It makes you sound way cooler than you are.
I'm dead, remember?
What, so they took you off their files or something?
THIS IS NOT THE TIME TO BE HAVING THIS CONVERSATION.
Let's get going then!
Wait.
What is it now?

The DRAWER in the DESK peaks your interest, particularly the FLOOR of it. You fumble with it and manage to lift it, revealing a FAKE BOTTOM. In the bottom, you find A STASH OF ILLICT DRUGS, A HOUSEHOLD KEY CARD, A CHAMELEON IDENTIFICATION CARD, and ONE THOUSAND DUCKETTS.
Appears our politician was more corrupt than we knew.
Uh-huh.
Ignoring IRENE'S COMMENT, you grab everything and put it in YOUR PACK.

Alright, alright, calm down. We have Irene, remember?
Now you're relying on me?
Don't make me doubt doing so.
Suddenly, you hear gurgling in the POWDER ROOM, and some choking.
Shit, he's not dead.
I could've sworn...
You still saved my life. Don't get upset about it.
Well... It doesn't matter. We need to go. Like now.

Actually, keeping him alive, while dangerous, could certainly push you towards finding this "Squorchy". You check YOUR PACK for anything to apprehend him. IRENE extends out TWO ARMS, catching your drift.
If we're going to kidnap him, we need to be quick.
What the fuck, Emmett!
Come on.

You enter the POWDER ROOM and notice FELIC, who was having trouble breathing. IRENE picks him up and coils him around with the ARMS, making sure to crush FELIC'S BODY just enough so that he could not get away and so that his breathing issues left him.
H-Holy fuck... Purgatory is real...
Thank me later.
Fuck you.
I don't feel good about this...
The OFFICE DOOR bursts open with a group of ARMED GU SEC OFFICERS.
LET GO OF THE MAN.
HANDS UP!
DOWN TO THE GROUND!
Uh...
In their confusion, they all aim directly at you, ignoring WES as per the norm at this point. IRENE takes out her CANNONS with her OTHER TWO ARMS. You decide to walk closer to them, trusting IRENE.
BACK OFF!
WE WILL SHOOT!
DOWN TO THE GROUND!

You take out your MAGGO-PISTOL from the PACK, which causes the ROOM to become hushed. Without even needing to aim it at anyone, you simply walk out of the OFFICE, the SEC OFFICERS moving out of the way. WES follows suit, and the two of you make your way out of THE CORE CENTER. You occasionally point your BIOLOGICAL WEAPON at some people, but for the most part, no one wants to bother with you, oddly. Maybe the GU is not treating them well? You do not know. The moment you and WES make it back to YOUR SHIP, your confidence falters, and YOUR HEART starts beating quickly.
H-How the fuck did that work?
Is that a Maggo-Pistol?
What's it to you?
Checking the news, this core center was almost completely massacred by Biological Weaponry, particularly from Maggo-Pistols.
I wonder how that happened...
Irene, strap him to a seat. I need to interrogate him.
IRENE drops FELIC into a SEAT and quickly locks him in with a strap on the SEAT.
Now, if you're as stupid as I think you are, you're going to leave the planet.
Booby-trapped?
Yes, actually. Planetary shield will obliterate the ship given that its harboring known fugitives. At least one of you is a tad sharp.
You roll your eyes. Well, there must be some way to get out of here.
Get Irene to.... do something! Quick! ⇒
You start the SHIP quickly and head it towards the PLANETARY SHIELD.
Squoatling. I know I just called you stupid, but I didn't actually think you were going to do this.
Shut up. Irene.
Oh, you rang?
Irene, I need you to get us out of this.

IRENE. PLEASE.

Okay...

Irene, we're going to die!

Press the yellow button beneath the navigational console. Provided this is a brigship, and provided most brigship tech is standardized across the galaxy, it should override the shield logic and let us through.
You press the YELLOW BUTTON as IRENE demanded and stare at FELIC with a smug look. He looks dumbfounded.

Surprised?
You're still stupid.
As the SHIP passes through the BARRIER unscathed, WES holds HIS CHEST and slumps to the FLOOR.

The standardization of carrying fugitives across planetary borders is not new news by any means. Ironically, the barrier killing us would be breaking the GU's laws on war crimes... at a GU bureaucratic center.

You head to the MINI FRIDGE at the PILOTING CONSOLE and grab a bottle of LLAMANOUS, an off-tasting, non-alcoholic, but nonetheless delicious, shoot of VORPABERRY WINE. Fellow who is superior to you in every way?
Racist.

Bite me.

You give WES a slight smile. It never occurred to you that you two were now friends after all that has happened so far. You have always just thought you were partners.

Revolting. You know that his species eats their own young, right?

So it's a moot point then.
He's so out-of-touch with his own species too. How can you trust him?
Without him, I would be rotting in a Llamanian prison right now. Bro needs to lay off my guy's cock.

Squoatling penises are nasty, and if you had an ounce of a brain, you'd put two and two together that his penis is grotesque.
I BET YOU IT'S LONG AND PRETTY.

That's... fair. You win this time, Tawfeek, as much as I hate to admit it.

They aren't. They're ciphered digits that encrypt coordinates, from what I can tell. Unfortunately, the sketchy guy I got them from is the only source I have to potentially decode them.
Who did you get them from?
Lizard, I could say any person in the galaxy and you still would know nothing of value.
You look at WES, who looks back at you angrily. You take a short sip of your drink and exhale.

Who cares what he likes?

Ask Felic if this is Felps. ⇒
Is this guy Felps?
FELIC looks surprised for a moment, and then his disposition changes to that of irritation.
I understand now.
He sighs, leaving you and WES confused.
Spit it out.
So he was the guy who lead you to my office?
What? No. We just wanted information.
Wes, calm down. There's nothing to gain from lying to him.
He doesn't need to know.
He's already figured it out, you dingus.
Felps told us to steal this drive from your office.
You show the drive to him. He smirks, seemingly amused despite his restrained state.
Ah. He wanted to lead you on to kill me probably. That drive has some nasty blackmail on it.
How so?
Oh, you know. Felps's weird fetishes with justices, other co-workers. Murders he authorized to occur. The usual with corrupt GU politicians.
Awful.

It appears that FELIC has calmed down for now. You consider undoing his restraints, despite him mentioning that he wanted to kill you. However, you realize that you need to actually lead A PRISONER before offering him a carrot.
Felic, I need to know something.
I'm sure you need to know a lot.
You push YOUR PRIDE aside and push on.
How did you find Vurkallus?
Who again?
You stare at him, furrowing YOUR BROW.
Oh. The female squoatling. I'm surprised given your history in bounty hunting that you never heard.
Honestly, while we were formally bounty hunters, we kinda' kept to ourselves and became more of a family than anything...
I don't care. What I was trying to imply was that Squorchy's in a similar profession. You know how pirates are often on the GU News?
She's a pirate?
... She's part of a crew that regularly resides around the ADE, hence why you've probably never heard of her.
Yeah, funnily enough we were always on the other side of the galaxy. Seth didn't want anything to do with it.
FELPS looks annoyed from YOUR COMMENT, clearly not caring. After a second, though, he lightens up, attempting to look interested.
I don't blame him. ADE's a poverty-stricken mess nowadays. Would've probably torn your crew to shreds.
You frown.
No offense.
... On other news, how do we get to Felps?
I don't want to deal with him again, and I definitely do not want you to find Squorchy and...
He clears HIS THROAT. WES sighs, expecting what would follow.
Mate with her to spawn more of you.
You exhale in frustration.
Felic, do you have a life's purpose?
I beg your pardon?
Seriously. Do you have a reason for being the way you are, for continuing to work against me?
You're prying into my personal life then? Low blow.
If you share with me, I'll share with you.
I want to solve the reason life exists. How it works. How some beings have a conscious and how others just exist for the sustenance of the sentient.
And you hate squoatlings because their existence goes against everything you've studied, researched, and experimented with thus far.

Precisely. You guys just kind of appeared in the timeline of the galaxy. The Orbacle showed a massive source of energy in the Vortox system that just appeared from nowhere around two thousand GUYs ago. That's a sign of creationism, or a source of newfound sentience.
Uh... I'm sorry? The Orbacle?
It's a trinket I acquired. It shows the timeline of the galaxy and locations of clusters of "conscious beings" throughout it. At least, that's what I understand of it.
You raise an EYEBROW in interest.
Huh. So you're saying that squoatlings were a blip on the radar, with no foreshadowing?
A very large, unnatural blip.
Interesting. You know, that kind of makes sense.
How so?
You look up at the ceiling trying to word this properly.

Well, Squoatlings are a newer species that progressed much, much faster than most other species. Despite this we still have animalistic tendencies that occasionally override our thought processes and actions.
Interesting, in a crude way.
The thing is, we know our creator exists. If Squoat made us two thousand GUYs ago, so be it. If he uplifted us from primitivity to modernity, so be it. That's not odd or weird whatsoever.

It's an anomaly. All uplifted species, at least since the creation of the GU, haven't progressed past a certain pre-spacefaring stage on their own. The fact that you guys managed to surpass most ancient civilizations in a lesser span of time without any known help aside from this "Squoat" is infuriating.
And that's my fault... why?
It... It just doesn't make sense. There's something deeper than it, and squoatlings go against the galaxy's grand design.
What is the grand design?
WES was twitching from the intellectual conversation, growing impatient.
Holy shit, just fuck and make up already. Emmett's species is weird, and you're too close-minded to allow something that you refuse to believe to exist. We get it. We're done. Let's go.
The COCKPIT grows quiet, with FELIC staring into YOUR EYES, the voids in HIS EYES making you a little uneasy.
I agree, skip this part of the adventure and just get on with it already.
I think I'm going to puke.
I can let you go if you need to.
Emmett, shut up.
I spent way too much of my time plotting your destruction over what, a stupid globe filling my brain with forbidden knowledge?
Forbidden knowledge sounds like it would come with a price.
And it did...
You decide to let FELIC out of THE SEAT out of pity.
Emmett, what the hell?!
I uh... I don't know what to do anymore with my life.
You can help me in my quest to find Squorchy.
I don't know, it... I think I'm going to need more time before we can be friends.
Well, you're free to stay on the ship while you... reflect.
Before you go wallow in self-shame, can we get a meeting with Felps?
I have him on holo-dial. I'll call him to arrange a meeting in a couple of minutes.
Finally.
You watch as FELIC leaves the COCKPIT, taking out his WATCH to get ready to call FELPS. You can't help but give a soft smile, despite everything.
I think we should've killed him.
I think you should shut up.
I think she's right. That guy literally tried to kill us not twenty minutes ago.
It was all a misunderstanding, and it's hard for me to grow grudges.
I'm starting to realize that, considering that you've dated Llamanians from what I can tell.
Squeeze Wes into a lizard smoothie. ⇒
Thinking about it, you've never tried LIZARD before, and its been many, many GUYs since you've last had a smoothie.
Hey Wes, I heard that some anole eat each other as a form of... well, some kind of ritual.
Do we really need to talk about this right now?
I don't see how this is prudent.
Just popped in my mind, but have you ever eaten an anole?
There was a long silence. WES coughs.
I'm not saying I have intentionally, but there is the possibility that some of the meat I was served while as a celebrity racer might have been lizardkin.
How did it taste?
WES looks at you with suspicion.
Emmett, are you thinking of eating me?
No, but in the case that your tail is hacked off, provided that it does grow back, I'd like to try and blend it with some Gulas milk.
I have no idea what to think of that. Can we get off this topic and head back to Felps?
Irene, look on the Hypernet for Squorchy and set a course for the planet where we met Felps.
Aye-aye, "captain".
You start to fiddle with your thumbs, seeing how long it seems to be taking to get back to the place where you met FELPS.
So... uh, Wes.
Yeah?
If I do manage to find this Squorchy, what do you plan on doing?
What do you mean?
You do know that once I find her, this whole adventure's going to come to a close.

Emmett, let's say, hypothetically, you do find her. What then? You're still going to be considered a terrorist by the GU. And they probably have some sort of tracker on our ship from us heading to their place of operations.
He's not wrong there. I'm not detecting anything at the moment, but  the GU does technically have the best... everything in the galaxy at their disposal.
Surprising, given how incompetent its members tend to be.
Unless we can remove your name from their hitlist, we're going to be at this for the rest of our lives, however short they might be.
Don't be so pessimistic.
WES stares at you, dead in the eyes.
It's being realistic. All we have that's protecting us is an AI with powerful weaponry that can be disabled at a moment's notice, and a Llamanian soldier who is effectively a private.
How do you know that about Los?
I heard that he was demoted from his previous position and given squoatling cleanup duty. I have exceptional hearing, dude.
Oh. Huh. Forgot about that.
It's a blessing and a curse.
Massage your horns to ease some stress. ⇒

After some time of lounging about, you start to feel tension from the past few equinoxes dwindle upon you. How much time has passed since you last were on the ESCAPE POD? Equinoxes? Weeks? Semesters? It feels as if you've spent a lifetime with WES and IRENE, and at the same time, you've barely got to know them. Yet, they've saved YOUR ASS on multiple occasions at this point. You hold YOUR HEAD a bit, starting to get a headache from just how lucky you've been on this expedition. You eyeball WES, who is currently reading an UNSAVORY RUMP MAGAZINE he managed to scrounge up from the WARDEN'S CREW QUARTERS. He sticks HIS TONGUE out in disgust from one of the FULL-PAGE IMAGES and looks over to you with a slight smile.
Honestly dude, I don't see how you can find mammary glands hot. They just stick out like a sore thumb on an otherwise smooth and slender body.
You roll YOUR EYES, flowing YOUR DIGITS through YOUR TUFT. WES puts down the MAGAZINE and frowns, noticing your state of being.
You okay man? I was just joking around-
Yeah, yeah, I'm fine. Just thinking about how ridiculous the past few equinoxes have been...
I get what you mean. It's crazy enough that we've survived so far.
You give WES a glare.
That's not helping.

... What I was going to say before you interjected was that we're capable. Sure, we might not be the toughest, but we have a death robot and a Llamanian soldier on our side. Not to mention the head of the GU's largest mafia. Plus, you have a bio-armament that shreds people alive.
I don't...
What?
I don't like killing these bystanders, Wes. Sure, we're a ragtag team of murderous vagrants. But there's no real honor in that, you know?
Who cares about honor, Emmett. I just want to live. I want to go back to racing, dude.
Like you said earlier, "we're going to be at this for the rest of our lives".
I was overexaggerating. We'll find a way.
You sigh, not knowing what the future holds.
Do you have a towel or something?
Huh?
A rag. A spare shirt. Whatever.
IRENE'S PACK extends a couple of ARMS that grab a PRISONER'S OUTFIT from a nearby HANGER. They tear up the OUTFIT and hand you one of the newly produced RAGS.
Thanks Irene.
I take it that you need to cool down? Your head's getting real hot.
Something like that...

You get up and head to a SINK inside of one of the BRIG CELLS and wet the RAG with warm water. After squeezing the RAG of excess water, you head back to the COCKPIT and sit down, taking off YOUR SHIRT and YOUR SWEATER. WES gets up and fondles the WARDEN'S CONSOLE a bit.
Need me to turn up the heat? I wouldn't mind it.
Knock yourself out.

You take a deep breath and meticulously rub the RAG on YOUR HORNS. You shiver from the delicate touch, emptying your mind of the stress of the past. You have one objective that you've been gunning for for most of your life at this point: find another squoatling. You sigh softly as WES turns up the heat, the temperature of the SHIP helping you mellow out a bit.

After some time of massaging YOUR SENSITIVE HORNS and WES awkwardly expressing an interest in learning about NAKED MAMMALIAN GIRLS, the SHIP enters the gravity well of the BARREN, ROCKY PLANET you met FELPS on from before. FELIC enters the COCKPIT, scoffing at your lack of CLOTHES on YOUR TORSO.
He's not going to be happy with you guys returning with me in tow.
Yeah, well, I'm not happy with meeting up with this corrupt guy either. He swindled us.
That's why he deserves to pay!
You grimace from WES and IRENE saying the same messed-up statement at the same time.
I wouldn't suggest killing him until you get the Orbacle, at the very minimum.
You look up at FELIC in confusion.
You're saying he has the Orbacle?!
Had to trade it with him for a lead on annihilating your species.
You flare YOUR TEETH in disgust.
... Which I regret doing now. It was inappropriate.
You can say that again.
Clearly if I wanted to kill you off successfully, I should have kept the Orbacle and taken his cipher by force.
Felic, calm down.
FELIC sighs and holds HIS HEAD.
Apologies. Some thoughts should stay to myself.
A silence permeates the COCKPIT. You put on YOUR SWEATER AND SHIRT COMBO and stand from the PILOT'S SEAT.
Alright. Where's this Felic guy?
The SHIP lands. Despite how small the PLANET is, you don't see him anywhere.
He should have a base somewhere in this area. Its where he wanted me to meet him.
IRENE, without question, hacks into the SHIP'S SENSORS and searches for a BASE upon the PLANET.
The base is within a fifty meter range of the ship in the northeast.
Couldn't you be a bit more specific, Irene?
No, because his base is cloaked and is using jammers. I used the ship's sensors to approximate the location through finding the most severe point of comms interference.
You sigh.
Thanks Irene. I appreciate the help.
What did she say?
She said that the base is cloaked, so it's practically invisible to the naked eye. It's within fifty meters in...
WES points in the northeast direction while still on the SHIP.
That direction.
Let's get walking then.

You, FELIC, and WES exit the SHIP and head off in the direction IRENE guided you to head in. IRENE continues to pinpoint various directions using the PACK'S own sensors before WES smacks his face against an INVISIBLE WALL.
Ow.

Well, how should you approach this? Do you try to find another entrance than the MAIN ENTRANCE to the BASE? Do you try to slip in undetected? Break down the BASE and grab FELIC by force? What's the plan, man?
Order Irene to blast a hole in the wall. ⇒
Alright, Irene, take out the cannon and blast that wall Wes just hit. We're going loud.
WES quickly backs away from the wall.
Jeez', that's a bit drastic, don't you think? Wouldn't this guy have some sort of security measures in place if he has a cloak over this base?
Fair point, but we're not trying to sneak up on him. We're trying to extort information out of him. And the Orbacle.
If you have a better plan, Wes, lay it on me.
I think we've wasted enough time here.
IRENE takes out the CRAB CANNONS from the HOLOPACK and charges them up.
Move further away, Wes!

WES continues to back away, unaware of how much IRENE is planning to charge the CANNONS. After a moment, IRENE shoots, the CANNONS releasing a colorful, powerful plasmic blast at the WALL. A boom echoes through the limited atmosphere, and the INVISIBLE WALL collapses in on itself. An ALARM blares momentarily before WES shoots what he thought was causing the noise.
Let's get going.

From the ENTRANCE you've made, a drop awaits you to a BASEMENT level. To the right is a SET OF STAIRS connecting the BASEMENT to the INDUSTRIAL MESH FLOOR ahead, where FELPS is sitting, pondering the ORBACLE. He's clearly startled from your intrusion.
Ah, Emmett, Wes! Did you get me the blackmail stick?
Felps. We need to talk.
FELIC peers through the ENTRANCE, staring down the SMALL MAN ahead of him.
Felic?! What a surprise! Do you have the stick?
I think we're beyond cushiony politics at this point.
FELIC tosses the USB STICK that he managed to take from you between your scuffle and now to FELPS, who catches it without issue. He then points YOUR MAGGO-PISTOL at him. WES glares at you angrily.
YOU GAVE THE GUY WHO TRIED TO MURDER YOU YOUR WEAPON?!
You give a look of worry over to WES, confused over when and how this happened.
Felic, you better give me that when we're done here.
IRENE cocks the extended cannons over at FELIC'S BACK.
We'll see.
FELIC pushes off the WALL BELOW and manages to extravagantly land on the FLOOR ahead. He points the MAGGO-PISTOL directly at FELPS' FACE.
Hand the artifact back, imbecile.
Not until you apologize for this.
FELPS holds the USB STICK up and waves it at FELIC, clearly unworried about MAGGO-PISTOL threat. There is an uncomfortable tension growing in the air.
We should follow suit.
I'm confused...
This is most certainly an ambush, Emmett. If we go in there, it's likely we're going to get taken advantage of. Remember, Felic can turn me off whenever he pleases.
Irene, this Orbacle is our lead on finding Squorchy. This is all I've dreamed of for... twelve GUYs.
Is a dream worth dying for?
You pause for a bit, considering the situation. You decide to watch and watch FELPS and FELIC for a bit.
You betrayed me, Felps. You stole the Orbacle from me, and you threatened to cut funding for my plans.
Your cause?! We're in this together! Just because I wanted you to actually pay attention to me instead of this damned sphere does not mean I've betrayed you!
You grimace from the awkward tension.
Look Felps, these vagrants nearly beat me to death here. I couldn't kill them on my own. If I had the Orbacle, I could've foreseen your meddling and better prepared for the scuffle.
I literally handed Emmett to you on a silver platter and you still fucked up.
I'M NOT SOME BARBARIAN, NUMBSKULL! I RESEARCH FOR A LIVING!
YOUR EYES start to glaze over as the two remain silent in thought. Eventually, they embrace, holding each other tightly.
Look, I'm sorry for this. I shouldn't have taken advantage of you.
It's okay. I just want you to not be so engrossed in this plan of yours, Felic.
I even brought them here, so we can take them out together, baby.
YOUR FACE scrunches up in disgust as the two kiss. WES grabs you by your collar and pulls you to a part of the WALL that is still standing, out of view.
I TOLD YOU WE SHOULD'VE KILLED HIM!
Wes, I-
HE FUCKING TOOK ADVANTAGE OF YOU BEING A PANSY!
Er...
I agree with Wes. You dropped the ball here, and you're over here telling me to listen to you.
I had a lasp of judgment! What the hell, guys?!
WES scoffs.
A big one at that.
FELIC shoots YOUR MAGGO-PISTOL out the ENTRANCE you've made, GERALD THE MAGGOT whizzing right by YOUR BACK.
Come out, squoatling. You've got nowhere to run.
We're not going to kill you if you just collaborate!
You can hear an audible slap on the head and muttered speech that you can't make out. You look over to WES, wide-eyed.
What did they say?!
Felic said, "Don't give away our plans, idiot!"
GET IN HERE ALREADY!
Well, you're in trouble. Do you obey FELIC'S ORDERS? Do you make a run back to the BRIG SHIP? What now?!
BOOK IT! ⇒

The HAIRS ON YOUR NECK flare up as you realize you're in a deadly situation, regardless of what WES is telling you. You look at your surroundings; the BARREN WASTELAND of the MOON you're on provides no means of escape nor refuge. Your only option is to run back to the SHIP.
We need to go!
That's not a smart idea, Emmett!
The ship's right in view of the hole we blasted!
The Maggo-Pistol's range isn't that long, guys!
You're talking about a weapon I created, bastard!
You close YOUR EYES for a moment and bolt towards the SHIP.
DAMNIT, EMMETT!

WES runs behind you, and IRENE tries to take out the HOLOPACK'S LEGS. However, before IRENE is able to boost you onto the SHIP, HER LEGS dig into the ground, causing you to trip. You hang a couple of inches from the ground from the HOLOPACK. You gasp, given the impact of your fall.
IRENE!
Ahead of you, WES is shot with a HIGHSPEED PLASMA BALL, throwing him away from the SHIP'S ENTRANCE.
I told you squoatling, GET OVER HERE!
You hear FELIC come up from behind you as WES scrambles to get up, the blast having winded him.
Don't try anything, lizard.
FELIC comes around into view waving a REMOTE around and your MAGGO-PISTOL. He presses a button on the REMOTE, causing you to fall.
You're pathetic, you know that?
He steps on YOUR BACK, holding you in place.
Get... get it over with!
You struggle beneath him until he squats down and bashes you with the butt of your MAGGO-PISTOL, knocking you unconscious.

You awaken with a violent smack across the face, unable to move YOUR ARMS to defend yourself. You look around, realizing that you're tied to A SPARE WOODEN CHAIR with little wiggle room. YOUR HEAD is absolutely pounding you, HORN SHAVINGS litter the floor, and you feel a sanguine taste in YOUR MOUTH. You shutter and spit up some blood, it flowing down YOUR BEARD.
Finally, he's fucking awake.
FELIC scowls at you and grabs YOUR HAIR TUFT, pulling YOUR HEAD up.
Goddamn, Felic. You don't have to torture the kid.
Why should we care? We're going to kill him anyways.
We said we wouldn't if he followed our orders.
Yeah, well, that time has passed, hasn't it?
FELPS groans.
We still need to question him first.

It's difficult for you to concentrate with YOUR HEAD pounding so hard. You're reminded of a previous time you were injured like this, around the time SETH saved you from the debris in your parents' mansion so many GUYs ago. It hurt back then, and it definitely hurts now. Dad certainly gave you a sheltered life, for better or worse.
Wakey, wakey.
FELIC violently shakes you.
B-Bite me.
You try to spit in his general direction but manage to fail, spewing onto the floor beneath you.
Cute. Even when you know you're about to die you still remain defiant.
Just do it already...
What, and end the fun early?
Felic, just ask the damn questions already.
FELIC scoffs and lets go of YOUR HEAD. You slump over and breathe heavily, your body agonizing. You look to your side, WES in a similar predicament to you, albeit less bloodied and less awake.
Kid. Where did you get this SIP?
FELIC grabs and shakes the HOLOPACK for emphasis.
W-Why does it matter...?
Answer the question. My finger's itching.
FELIC raises the MAGGO-PISTOL to YOUR FOREHEAD, his FINGER on the trigger. You stare FELIC dead in the eyes, his crude threats no longer fazing you.
Some convenience store.

FELIC smacks you across the face with the butt of the MAGGO-PISTOL. You clench YOUR TEETH baring the brunt of his assault. You haven't felt this much adrenaline in your entire life. Maybe it's being in a life or death situation against SOMEONE WHO TRULY HATES YOU, maybe it's brain damage from the torture. Something has awakened in you.
What the fuck, Felic?!
BE MORE SPECIFIC, INSOLENT FOOL! YOUR LIFE IS ON THE LINE!
You give a weak, morbid chuckle and mutter, albeit loud enough for FELIC to hear.
Hasn't it always?
You hear FELIC'S GRIP tighten around the TRIGGER and a familiar clicking from the MAGGO-PISTOL. FELIC tilts HIS HEAD, cracking HIS NECK in an attempt to be intimidating.
LAST CHANCE, DIPSHIT. HOW DID YOU GET THIS SIP?
Felic, we killed Maxwell. With a bomb. There was nothing left.
FELIC shakes and turns, enraged at his partner's impudence.
This is Maxwell's SIP, you idiot! The trojan will end us if we don't track it down!
That makes no sense...
You blot out their meaningless bickering. You stare directly into the BARREL of the MAGGO-PISTOL, looking into the void. Was it comforting? Sickening?
You remain confident all the same despite the daggers of your nervous system pressuring you otherwise.
Dream of Llamanians long past. ⇒
The solace of the dark pit puts into mind various rambling thoughts, as if your life is passing before YOUR VERY EYES. Time slows to a crawl.

You really were a coward, weren't you? Always trying to take a naive, peaceful solution to everything. SETH certainly was right in most of his murders related to bounty hunting, at least when they weren't accidents. Some people are truly evil incarnate, and irredeemable.

Does that make you an accomplice of evil for fighting for their lives? No, it doesn't, but it does show that you didn't know any better. Instead of dealing with those demons and growing as an individual, you just smoked and smoked and smoked all of your problems away. At one point in your life, you certainly have thought, "Why can't we all just get along?" while witnessing your dad brutalize a drug kingpin.

Did you turn a blind eye to his terrible actions because you're a terrible person, or did your trauma take a part in it? It's possible that both are true, but it's also possible that you have an unconditional love for your father. Maybe one should strive to look for peaceful compromises in life while also delivering swift justice to those evils. The question is, how do you determine someone's strictly an irredeemable monster?
You wonder what your biological father would have thought about SETH after every thing you've been through.

You grieve for the hundreds of Llamanians you and your crew have killed. Even though their directives were inherently evil at first, many of them had families and lives. And you willingly snuffed them out all in self-preservation and vengeance. And despite all the lives you claimed, they still forgave you and protected you, just as you forgave them before. Despite your hardships, safety was practically guaranteed for you, and you always took it for granted. But life demands tribute, and will always be transactional---ups and downs.
Do you deserve to live?
You close an eye and try to focus within the BARREL of the MAGGO-PISTOL to catch a glimpse of GERALD. You wonder if the MAGGOT has a particular taste for flesh. Would YOUR FLESH even taste good?
FELIC notices your shifting and stops bickering with FELPS, turning towards you.
Fuckface. What gas station?!

The mere sight of FELIC'S REVOLTING FACE fills you with the willpower to continue fighting. You give him a Kafkaesque smile, pushing YOUR HEAD into the BARREL. He's clearly taken aback by your suicidal expression.
Damnit, I'm not kidding!
You bite down on YOUR LIP, waiting patiently for FELIC to pull the TRIGGER. YOUR CANINES dig, fluid filling YOUR MAW.
He's not cooperating, Felps!
FELPS groans and slams HIS HEAD into the TABLE before him.
So be it!
Click... click... The TRIGGER is squeezed to its fullest extent before the GUN activates.
Yes, you deserve to live.
Before FELIC is able to shoot his MAGGO-PISTOL, you spew the sanguine fluid directly into HIS FACE and headbutt the GUN, causing FELIC to shoot, ultimately missing YOUR HEAD.
WHAT THE FUCK!
In a panic, FELIC throws the GUN behind him and desperately attempts to get the BLOOD out of HIS EYES. GERALD, on cue, whizzes by you and reaches the fullest extent of the MAGGO-PISTOL'S range.
FELPS, GRAB THE GUN AND KILL HIM!

You shake in anticipation as you notice that the MAGGO-PISTOL is in the perfect position to attack FELIC on GERALD's rebound, which is precisely what happens. The GUN whistles, causing some sort of electromagnetic frequency to lure the MAGGOT back to its CHAMBER. You lunge to the side and fall as you hear this, acknowledging that you would be lunch otherwise. Before FELPS can get up from HIS CHAIR, GERALD latches onto FELIC'S WAIST.
The world is your oyster, Felic. It just so happens you've shucked yourself.
You laugh sinisterly as GERALD starts to burrow into FELIC'S HIPS. FELIC howls in terror as he attempts to pull the MAGGOT off of him, managing to rip himself apart.
Watch. ⇒
WHY THE FUCK WOULD YOU DESIGN THE WEAPON TO DO THAT, FELIC?!
FELIC jumps up and tries his best to grab the MAGGOT to no avail. It has already embedded itself within THE MAN'S BODY, butchering and liquifying his insides.
FUCK YOU, YOU'VE KILLED US ALL! KILLED US ALL! KILLED US ALL!...

FELIC continues to scream repeatedly to cope with his demise, HIS HAND shaking and pointing directly at you. Eventually his yells turn to whimpers, and then to gasps as his bodily structure deteriorates. Only gory scraps, blood, and hairs remain when GERALD finally returns to his CHAMBER.
WES watches, mortified. He's been awake for some time from the couple's argument.
WHAT KIND OF GOD WOULD LET SUCH A WEAPON EXIST?!
You pant, the pain coming back to you, a soft, guilty smile apparent on your face as you lie on your side.
FELPS trembles on the floor, HIS HANDS entrenched in what remains of FELIC. He is speechless.
Well, what now?
